El sueño de Reina, es tener su propia casa, que su negocio de ropa crezca aún más y tener un carro para poder ir a ofrecer su producto a otros lugares más lejanos.
texts.en:
Reina is a 34 year old housewife. She studied up to grade 2 and did not continue as her parents did not have the financial resources to allow her to continue. She is in a relationship but does not yet have any children. Her life companion works in agriculture while Reina has been selling clothing for 5 years.

Reina learned this business due to her economic situation and to help her husband with the household expenses. Reina sells clothing around her community, her timetable is from 8 am until 5 pm every day. The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy more clothing so she can offer some more products to her clients. In this way she will have more income to help more with the household expenses and be able to pay off the loan with no problem.

Reina's dream is to have her own house, that her clothing business grows more and to have a car to be able to offer her products in other places further away.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Bibiodinamo

texts.en: Bibiodinamo is a strong woman. She lives in a village. She is married. She has about 18 years of experience doing business. Her husband does not work. She, alone, is financially responsible for her family. Her husband helps her grow vegetables in their yard. They plant and sell potatoes, carrots, etc. Her business is seasonal, and it is not the season for those vegetables now. Bibiodinamo wants to start a business of buying and selling cattle. She needs financial support for buying cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bamboo, gasoline, and fishing net for her fishing business. Jocelyn has been in this business for 24 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, gasoline, and fishing net

loans.name: Nuhu Shawai

texts.en: Nuhu Shawai is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu Shawai would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to receive cash for his immediate needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu Shawai can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Nuhu Shawai is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 32 years old, single, and lives in Pallua Norte. To make a living, he manages a cornfield. 

Jimmy wants to improve his crop production, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticide, and insecticide to use in his farming business. 

Additional revenue will be kept for emergency purposes and revolving capital in his business. He wants to become a successful farmer someday.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticide, and insecticide to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram comes from a rural area. He is 29 years old, a widower and has no children. He lives with his parents. The only source of family income is from his agriculture business. Akram has been busy growing fruits and vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, tomatoes and apples. Akram earns additional income from animal husbandry. He has worked this way for more than nine years. He has great experience in this field and little by little is developing his business. Akram plans to repair his house which is in poor condition, He is asking for a loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina, 63-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, operates a buko business (more commonly known as coconut business). She is married to Ireneo, and together they manage their own household while operating the buko business. They are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and to always meet the needs of their children, who are all still in school.

Justina buys coconut fruits that are native to the Philippines, which are grown mostly in the southern area of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of buko to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to pay for the maintenance of the vehicle being used to deliver buko to their customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Justina wants to grow her business, and she also desires to buy another vehicle to be used to transport their products. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more buko and to pay for the maintenance of truck used to deliver buko to dealers and regular customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machines he needs in his work in the blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. 

Imelda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Josephine is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers.  Gina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Limphasa Group

texts.en:
Wanting to improve her standard of living, Jane, 65, started selling different items such as sugar, salt and soap in her grocery store to people in her community. Jane has five children and looks after one orphan. The profit she makes from her business helps her to provide for her children's basic needs, such as clothing.  

Jane will use the loan to expand her business by buying more commodities for her grocery store and this will help her to attract more customers while also increasing her profits. She plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to send them to better schools. The profits from the previous loans have helped provide enough food throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grocery items.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 52 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adela has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Daniel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hosea, Blessing and Yapet. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Daniel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Almabubu

texts.ru: Алмабубу 53 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Алмабубу - высшее образование, она работает учителем начальных классов, также с 1998 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Алмабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы и 15 овец. Дети в свободное время активно помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Алмабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации экологически чистого домашнего и очень вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита позволят Алмабубу развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Almabubu is 53 and married with four children. She has a higher education and works as a primary school teacher. Since 1998 she has also been working in animal husbandry as a secondary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and 15 sheep. Her children help around the farm in their free time. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Almabubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow for production and sale of delicious organic milk. Profits from the loan will allow her to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase production of organic milk

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik lives in Vazashen, a frontier village in the Tavush region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, 98-year-old mother, and 2 sons. His older son works in the Russian Federation while his younger son is still in school. 

Norik says that he has always farmed, and he really is now a very skilled farmer. His farm was once very rich. But, having financial difficulties, Norik sold some of his cattle, which now he hopes to bring back with help from this loan. Currently he has 3 cows, a calf, a pig, and 20 chickens. He sells milk, macun (an Armenian dairy product), cheese, eggs, and some meat. His orchard also brings some income to his family with its harvest of persimmon, fig, and cornel berries. 

Around his village Norik also earns some income from tractor-driving. He is very skilled with his tractor, and since there are very few experienced tractor drivers left in his village, he receives many orders. 
 
Norik hopes very much that Kiva lenders will help him buy cattle fodder and enlarge his farm with the purchase of several pigs.

loans.use: to buy cattle fodder and enlarge his farm with the purchase of several pigs.

loans.name: Careen

texts.en:
This is Careen, 31, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerson who works as a security guard, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Careen operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the highlands which are well suited to growing pineapple. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go toward the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Careen hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business and she dreams of expanding soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Asociacion 5 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, activa, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ que  es una pequeña área ubicada al este de la ciudad, es conocido por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Gabriela es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lacio, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro usa blusa negra y pantalón azul). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que no trabajan y está construida de ladrillo; cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Los deseos de mejorar su negocio la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de muebles, venta de sabanas, confección de carteras, venta de salteñas, confección de polleras, servicio de transporte y tienda de videos, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior, en la sección de damas ofrece: Brasier (escote profundo y realce incorporado) Tangas (en encajes y micro fibras), Body (de control fuerte busto y libre clásic), Interiores para caballeros (Bóxer largo en algodón) Calcetines o medias, Ropas para niños (bodies y mamelucos), conjuntos bebe, niños, niñas y
calcetines. “el negocio de ropa interior es bastante amplio, parece que fuera sencillo, pero existe mucha variedad para ambos sexos y para niños…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y surtida. Ella dese ampliar su negocio mediante la compra por mayor de ropa interior de ambos sexos y para niños, para abastecer a sus clientes y generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 27-year-old woman. She is single and doesn't have children. Her business is selling underwear. She is enterprising, independent, active, reliable, responsible, and hardworking. She runs her business in Cotoca, which is a small area located East from the city and well known for its traditional food and crafts, particularly ceramics. The weather is warm, tropical, and humid, and the temperature varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius year round.

Gabriela is short and has dark skin, black straight hair, and dark brown eyes. She is standing in the center of the picture, wearing a black top and blue pants. Her first language is Guaraní, which is spoken locally, and she also speaks Spanish, which she uses generally and while doing business. She lives in her parents' house, which is built out of brick and has running water, sewage, and electricity. Her parents don't work. 

In order to improve her business, she decided to lead a communal bank with other business owners to request a loan and expand her business. The other members work selling furniture, selling sheets, making purses, selling empanadas, sewing skirts, offering transportation services, and running a video store. Gabriela works selling underwear for women (low-cut and under-wire bras, lace and microfiber thongs, and shape-wear) and men (cotton boxers and socks), as well as baby clothes like onesies, and children's clothing for boys and girls.

"The underwear business is quite extensive. It looks simple, but there's lots of variety for both sexes as well as for children," she says. Her dream is to have a large and well-stocked store. She wants to expand her business by purchasing wholesale underwear for men, women, and children so that she can meet her customers' demand and generate a better income for her family. That is how she will use this loan. This is her third cycle with this organization and she has been in business for two years.

loans.use: to buy wholesale underwear.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Reina es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de tortillas y además, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia. De esta forma es como logra ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Reina desea invertir en sus pequeños negocios por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cereales, detergente, aceite, golosinas, sodas, maíz, gas propano, etc. de esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y por consecuencia sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Reina is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. Reina is a enterprising woman who makes a living selling tortillas and with much effort has additionally established a small store in her home residence. In this way she has succeeded in bringing home money to make a living.

Reina wants to invest in her small business so she has asked for a loan from FUSAI to buy cereal, detergent, oil, candy, sodas, corn, propane, etc. With this investment she wants to increase her sales and income, and consequently her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereal, detergent, oil, candy, sodas, corn, propane, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. The above picture presents Jane, a 38-year-old hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kapsowar, Kenya - a remote town with harsh living conditions due to the bad terrain in the region. 

Jane is happily married and, together with her husband, has 4 lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Jane is a tough woman with tough skin, and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling milk. The Kapsowar area has conditions that favor dairy farming, and Jane has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow. But the lack of capital has always prevented her. So today she is seeking a loan to buy this additional cow. 

However, the dairy cow she intends to buy is not just any ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will be able to produce more milk which will translate into more income. Demand for milk in the Kapsowar area is high, but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Jane is going to reap more and comfortably meet this demand. 

Her increased income will allow Jane to provide a secure future for her school-going children by being able to pay their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. 

Jane's vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a bio gas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: to buy a quality, exotic breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Abubakar Aliyu

texts.en: Abubakar Aliyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar Aliyu would have had to sell his  maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar Aliyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abubakar Aliyu expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en: Mahsat was born in 1960 and lives in a rural area with her family. She is married and has five children. She always cares for her children. Mahsat, since childhood, has experienced a lot of difficulties. She has run her own animal husbandry business for many years. Mahsat buys cattle, feeds the animals for several months and sells them at a local market. She has regular customers, thanks to the good condition of her cattle. Mahsat is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds and, in this way, increase business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is widowed. She lives with her six children in a rural area. Gulsara is a very hard-working woman. 

Gulsara is the only breadwinner for her children because her husband died in 2009. She works hard from early morning until late evening to earn a living and offer her children high-quality living conditions. 

Gulsara has an animal husbandry business. She has worked in this way for more than 20 years. She has great experience in this field. 

Gulsara must buy coal and wood to keep her house warm, but she does not have the money to do so. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to buy coal and wood for the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
El señor Eliodoro de 51 años de edad, vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene 4 años dedicarse al negocio de venta de detergentes,  es un hombre  trabajador  con muchos deseos de salir adelante y agradece a  Prisma ya que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y su vivienda gracias a prestamos anteriores.
Don Eliodoro está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de detergentes para revenderlos, espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Don Eliodoro uno de sus su sueños es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda.
                  
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señor Eliodoro, 51, lives in the village of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.  He has had a business selling detergent for four years. He is a hardworking man with a great desire to get ahead; and he thanks Prisma, as he has been gradually improving his business and his home with previous loans.

Don Eliodoro is requesting a new loan for the purchase of detergent in order to resell it; and he hopes that this investment will allow him to earn the income that is needed to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Don Eliodoro’s dreams are to stock his business better, and one day, improve his home more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December, 2014

loans.use: to purchase detergent for his business.

loans.name: Martha Licet

texts.es: Martha es una señora que imparte clases a niños de educación primaria, del cual tiene 11 años de laborar, es casada, con un  hijo a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda atravez de un financiamiento por el cual visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada y utilizarlo en Compra de cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques y mano de obra, con los que realizara las mejoras de un cuarto y de esa manera mejorara las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Martha is a primary school teacher. She has been teaching children for eleven years. She is married and has a son. She is currently in need of a loan to make home improvements, which is why she came to Ceprodel. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy cement, sand, gravel, and blocks, and pay for labor. She will have improvements done in one of the bedrooms and this will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and blocks, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more textile materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows for his business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Emelia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past for loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kuusela

texts.en:
Kuusela works hard to support her family. Kuusela is married and has a room-for-rent business in the Philippines.

Kuusela requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business.

Kuusela has been in this business for six years now.

Kuusela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her room-for-rent business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old, married, and has three children. 

Gina is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming sugarcane for six years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. Mary Jean is 55 years old and married, and has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. Fishing is her main source of income.
Mary Jean is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With the loan, she will be able to improve her catch, thus allowing her to sell more fish to the market.
In the future, Mary Jean hopes of making her business a success and stable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Estrella is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Estrella has been farming sugarcane for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Obdulio

texts.es: Obdulio de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado de repasto, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Obdulio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un toro para seguir con la crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Obdulio is 67 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He has been working raising beef cattle for several years. He sells his product in the surrounding areas.

Obdulio is requesting a loan to buy a bull to continue raising cattle and have more income.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe TIMINADIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Kouorobarrage un des villages de la zone d’intervention de SORO YIRIWASO de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame  Atime fait le commerce de condiment à travers le groupe
Timinadia. Debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt un carton de concentrée de tomate, un panier de 10 kg de gombo séché, 10 kg d’oignon. Elle s’approvisionne au  village. Les ventes sont faites également sur place à Kouorobarrage. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group TIMINADIA are married women, who average 35 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in  Kouorobarrage, a village in the Soro Yiriwaso area of operation, in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 1st solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Atime does commerce in condiments in the group TIMINADIA. Standing at the far right in the photo, she intends to use her loan to purchase a box of tomato paste, a 10-kg basket of dried okra, and 10 kg of onions. She gets her supplies in the village. Her sales are also made locally in Kouorobarrage. In demand by her customer base, composed mainly of women, for the quality of her products, she accepts cash as well as credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomato paste, onions, and okra

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: "Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers; and by that, I mean [those] people who make a living off of the land; and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Beatrice. She is a 37-year-old mixed farmer based in Birunda, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Beatrice has a husband and they have six children. For the last 10 years, Beatrice has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and vegetables. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Beatrice to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. Beatrice is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. She doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus, increase sales volume. Beatrice needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, está acompañada, realizó sus estudios hasta 3° grado, ella  vive con su pareja y sus 3 hijos los cuales estudian y su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura. 

María, se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo cual empezó hace dos años, ella comenzó en el negocio ya que su madre también comercializaba con ropa y fue de ella de quien aprendió este negocio.- Además, hace choco bananos y charamusca para vender.

María, solicita el crédito para comprar camisas y pantalones tanto para hombre como para mujeres. 

María, sueña con tener su propio puesto de ropa y también desea que sus hijos sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and has a life-companion. She studied until the third grade. She lives with her partner who works in agriculture and her three children who are students.

María works selling clothing which she began doing two years ago. She started the business as her mother also sells clothing and it was from her that she learned the business. She also makes chocolate bananas and charamuscas (frozen treats in plastic bags) to sell. 

María is asking for a loan to buy shirts and pants for men and women.

María dreams of having her own clothing stall and she also hopes her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy shirts and pants to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and a general store.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. Rosalie earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 22-year-old single lady. She lives in Ajloun with her family. Haneen has recently graduated with a bachelor degree in business administration and a very good GPA . She has registered to continue with her studies to get a master’s degree in electronic business to cover the new technology in the field. She dreams of becoming one of the pioneer business women in the community. Haneen is short on part of the semester fees, so she applied for this loan to cover it and pay the university.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees

loans.name: Inna Ja'afaru

texts.en:
Inna Ja'afaru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Esther, Deborah, and Abubakar.  

Previously, in order to cover her urgent expenses such as food and clothing, Inna Ja'afaru would typically have sold her maize soon after harvest, but when prices were lowest. 

However, now that she is a member of Babban Gona, with their support and this loan, Inna Ja'afaru can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

When asked, Inna Ja'afaru spoke of her ambition to use her additional income to educate her children, hoping to eventually ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Yusuf, Yunusa and Ketura.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en: Minkailu is a maize farmer from Barau village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Minkailu would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Minkailu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Minkailu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Haruna expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 42-year-old divorced mother of two children. For eight years, she has been employed in a factory to cover the needs and expenses of her family, for she is their sole earner.
Despite her limited salary, she is trying her best to provide her family with a better life. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to start a new business of selling accessories as a second source of income, in an attempt to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to open her own accessories shop in the future.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling accessories

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 42-year-old married father of four children. He has worked as an electrician since 1990 to cover the needs and expenses of his family.
Hussein's family is his priority and he is trying desperately to provide them with a better life. Due to increasing living costs, his income is not enough anymore. So, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.
Hussein hopes to develop his business more in the future to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a 50-year-old married mother of two children. She is a very enterprising woman. For more than 20 years, she has been busy with growing vegetables and feeding cattle. Her honesty, responsibility, and punctuality have been the reasons for her business promotion, and she believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself.

Gulbahor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and finishing building it. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life; she is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy paints, etc. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy paints, etc. to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is twenty-eight years old. He is married but does have any children. Suhrob works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He has a farming business where he grows potatoes and carrots on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has spent the past five years working hard from early morning till late evening.

Suhrob would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 Somoni. With this amount, he will purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIMINADIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Kouorobarrage un des villages de la zone d’intervention de SORO YIRIWASO de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame  Hawa fait le commerce de condiment à travers le groupe
Timinadia. Assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt un carton de concentrée de tomate, un panier de 20 kg de gombo sec, 30 kg d’oignon et 3 paquets de 20 unités de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché du village. Les ventes sont faites également sur place à Kouorobarrage. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group TIMINADIA are married women, who average 35 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in  Kouorobarrage, a village in the Soro Yiriwaso area of operation, in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 1st solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Hawa does commerce in condiments in the group TIMINADIA. Sitting at the far right in the photo, she intends to use her loan to purchase a box of tomato paste, a 20-kg basket of dried okra, 30 kg of onions, and three 20-unit packets of Maggi cubes [bouillon cubes]. She gets her supplies at the big market in the village. Her sales are also made locally in Kouorobarrage. In demand by her customer base, composed mainly of women, for the quality of her products, she accepts cash as well as credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as okra and onions

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en: Dilnoza is a business lady. She lives in a rural area. She is single. She has been working about four years as a seamstress, since 2011. She started out sewing dresses for kids. Now that she has more experience, she sews clothes and pants. She wants to make a better style and design of clothes for her costumers. She is planning to buy a new sewing machine. She would be pleased for financial support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Marites is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Mildred. She lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, renowned for being the basket area of Kenya. Mildred is a mother of five, and she has been in an agricultural business for six years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. Mildred has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizer, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. 

Despite these tough conditions, Mildred remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Mildred is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. A poultry farm is cheaper to run, and the demand for chicken products is always high. 

With this loan, Mildred will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profit. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. 

This loan will support Mildred’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Purisima is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Purisima has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, eggs, coffee, bread, beans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Keko

texts.en:
Keko is 57 years old and he used his previous loan to buy more livestock for resale. It was profitable and he was able to repay the loan. He also does crop farming in Narok town, growing wheat and maize. 

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and cattle feed. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

His future hopes are to grow his business, be prosperous and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and cattle feed..

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor, 30, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Sheryl who manages their household and has a child who is still in the elementary level in school. He works hard to provide income to support his family’s daily personal and household needs.

Nicanor operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. Nicanor has a charming personality so people prefer to buy at his store. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He also sells ready-to-wear clothes for kids and adults. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day. 

To help Nicanor continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn rice, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. Part of the loan will pay for ready-to-wear apparel to sell this Christmas season. He expects a higher demand for groceries and clothes as Christmas is fast approaching. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him. He wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Nicanor aims to grow his business to build a house and give his family a better life. He wants to give his child the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and alsos draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries and some ready-to-wear clothes for his store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Jenny is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Don Víctor Chavarría nació en un lugar llamado San Rafael del Norte en el año de 1952.Don Víctor le ayudaba a su madre en actividades de campo. Cuando cumplió 19 años empezó a trabajar cortando café esto fue para los años de 1971 o 1972. Luego conoció a doña Julia y decidió quedarse a vivir con ella y con doña Julia  procreo 6 hijos pero solo están vivos 4 hijos. Don Víctor con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar unas pocas tierras en la que tiene sembrado café y también tiene área para sembrar granos básicos el café que el cosecha lo cosecha con sus hijos, también el sale a cortar a las fincas cercanas para ganarse otros centavos.  El comenta que la vida es bastante difícil pero con la ayuda de Dios todo sale bien y se puede salir adelante. El con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar sus cosas y pudo hacer su casa, pero actualmente en la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y el quisiera poder alumbrarse de otra manera en su casa, actualmente se alumbra con candelas y con foco. el quisiera un préstamo para poder comprar un panel solar y así alumbrarse de otra manera y servirá para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Victor was born in a place called San Rafael del Norte in 1952. He used to help his mother work in the fields. When he turned nineteen he started working cutting coffee. This was around 1971 or 1972. Then he met Julia and decided to stay and live with her. Eventually, he and Julia had six children, but only four survive today. Victor worked very hard to buy a bit of land, where he grows coffee. He also has an area for basic grains. He harvests his coffee beans alongside his children, and he also goes out to work on nearby farms to make some extra money.

He says that life can be quite hard, but that everything turns out well with God's help and it's possible to get ahead. He has worked hard to buy his things and was able to build a house, but the community doesn't currently have electricity and he would like to be able to have an alternative source of light in his home. Currently he is using candles and flashlights. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a solar panel and bring light and power into his home for his whole family to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as peanut butter, onions, and mustard

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad operates a vulcanizing shop, offering services such as the repair and replacement of tires. She is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 10, 6, 5, and 3 years. She hails from the town of MacArthur, Leyte in the Philippines.

Soledad is requesting a loan in order to buy a vulcanizing tool kit for truck and motorcycles. These tools are very helpful in her operation, making her service both easier and faster. This will result in abundant customers dropping by to make use of her services.

She hopes to expand into a successful business, helping Soledad to not only provide her children with better living conditions but also continue sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy a vulcanizing tool kit for truck and motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana es una microempresaria emprendedora de 37 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, plata, y cosméticos en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace ocho años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de pantalones, camisas, shores, variedades de plata, perfumes, vanidades, marbellines, sobras, brillos labiales etc. Una de sus metas es pagar puntual las cuotas del préstamo para gozar de los beneficios de tener un buen récord crediticio.
texts.en: Ana is a 37 year old microbusiness entrepreneur. She is single and the mother of two children. She has sold clothes, silver and cosmetics in the municipal market for eight years. She is asking for a loan to buy bales of trousers, shirts, shorts, silver items, perfumes, compacts, mascara, eyeshadow, lip gloss etc. One of her goals is to make the loan repayments on time in order to benefit from having a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy bales of trousers, shirts, shorts, silver items, perfumes, compacts, mascara, eyeshadow, lip gloss etc. with the aim of increasing sales.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is a diligent woman. She was born in 1964 and lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and her husband works in security service. For almost seven years, she has run a retail business, buying and selling shoes for women, kids and men. She started with spring shoes and year by year she is trying to enlarge her business. With this loan, she is planning to buy seasonal shoes.

loans.use: To buy seasonal shoes to sell

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 43-year-old married mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. Mylen is a sari-sari or variety store owner. Mylen sells goods like soap and toiletries, canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods.. 
Mylen is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread, snack foods, and condiments. With a loan, Mylen will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 
In the future, Mylen hopes of making her business more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread, snack foods, and condiments

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly, 32, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sonny and they have five children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.

Nelly operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy toy products from wholesalers, repackage them and sell them for a little profit. Her products are assorted toys and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of toy products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nelly also wants to buy and operate her own transportation service like a tricycle unit for additional income. She hopes to give her family a better life through her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of toys and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jury, a tricycle driver, and has children who are already married. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday personal and household needs. 

Lilia operates a motorized tricycle and has a van for rent as well. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Dasmarinas, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. he town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends’ homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. 

Lilia earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan for maintenance of her tricycle. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is really a need in their place.

Lilia dreams to be more successful in her business. She is also looking forward to having grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liway works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling charcoal. Liway is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy bananas to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Liway has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell for her business

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abubakar joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Umar, Fisal and Fati.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Abubakar spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Umry

texts.en: Umry was born in 1963. She is widowed. Umry has a daughter and she lives with her in Tajikistan. Umry has worked in a hospital for more than fifteen years. She is a cleaning woman. She is the sole breadwinner of her family. Her salary is small and that’s why they live poorly. She must buy coal and wood for the winter season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame   Amissetou fait le commerce de légumes (concombre) à travers le groupe. Debout en troisième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt un carton de 10 paniers de 50 kg de concombre, 5 paniers de 20 kg de laitues. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit au marché central et à la maison. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a working-class district  in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 5th solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Amissetou does commerce in vegetables (cucumbers) in the group. Standing third from the right in the photo, she intends to use her loan to purchase a box containing ten 50-kg baskets of cucumbers and five 20-kg baskets of lettuce. In demand by her customer base, composed mostly of women, for the quality of her products, she accepts cash or credit at the central market and at her house.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in Iloilo, Philippines. Lea is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This has been their source of income for more than 10 years now.

Lea is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, a crab cage, hooks and lead weights. With a loan, Lea and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Lea hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, a crab cage, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Saitoti

texts.en:
Saitoti has a livestock trading business and a retail shop in Narok town and has been in this business for two years. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children. 

He has requested his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, and will use it to buy more stock of goods to sell. This includes goods such as sugar, tea leaves, flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand to buy a plot of land. In future he hopes to be successful in his business and provide employment to other people.

loans.use: To buy more stock of retail goods

loans.name: Noolkitoip

texts.en: Noolkitoip earns a living by selling shoes and clothes and also runs a hotel in the town of Narok. She has been working hard in these businesses for the past 10 years, and is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals to use in her hotel. This loan will allow her to serve more customers and generate more profits, which she will use to buy goats to raise and sell. This is her first loan and her goals for the future are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en: Georgette is a 37-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and lives with four children and husband, who is the main provider for the family. She is a private teacher who has been in this profession for two years and has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l., to buy a laptop. Georgette says that this equipment will improve her teaching skills, especially regarding the topics and exercises she teaches. In the future, she seeks to get additional Kiva loans in order to better arrange the area where she teaches her private students.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 60 years old, married, and had five children. She is married to Pablo, a tricycle driver in their village.

Julieta wanted to help her husband improve their services, so that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle. This will help improve her husband's transport services.

The additional revenue gained in their business will be kept for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma.Cecelia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her business.

Ma.Cecelia has been in this business for six years. Ma.Cecelia earns additional income from a motorcycle transport service.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

Ma.Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 60 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alejandra has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is separated and has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines.

Judith requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle. She has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

loans.name: Danny Stalin

texts.es: Danny tiene 34 años de edad es soltero vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Rios, el se dedica a l agricultura y solicita el credito para sembrar y comprar insumos agricolas gracias a este credito podra mejorar los cultivos y realizar su sueño de comprarse un terreno para hacer una casa para vivir con sus padres ya que ellos viven en condiciones no muy buenas, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Danny is 34 years old, and he is single.  He lives in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos Province, and he devotes himself to agriculture.  He is requesting a loan for planting and for purchasing agricultural supplies.

Thanks to this loan, he will be able to improve the crops and realize his dream of purchasing a plot of land in order to build a house to live in with his parents, as their living conditions are not very good.  

In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Katiuska Roxana

texts.es:
Katiuska tiene 22 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura ya que es el apoyo para sus padres y solicita el credito para la compra de lo necesario para sembrar maiz y obtener una produccion buena para poder solventar sus gastos ya que su sueño es estudiar, en su tiempo libre le gusta leer y tejer.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 22 years old, single, and living with her parents in the Ventanas Province of los Rios.

She makes a living in agriculture, and now supports her parents. She is requesting the loan to purchase what she needs to sow corn and get a good output to be able to settle her expenses. 

Since her dream is to study, in her free time she likes to read and knit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to sow corn

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Dinah, from the Kitale area of Kenya, left her “peanuts” paying job to become a full-time small holder farmer. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Dinah is married and blessed with four lovely children who she refers to as "my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Salma was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Dinah said. “It is in my blood.” 

For the past five years, Dinah has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is a lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers feel a sense of fulfilment from having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Dinah is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Dinah is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es: Julia tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, ella inició ofreciendo servicios a domicilio y poco a poco fue creciendo su clientela, entonces sintió la necesidad de empezar a organizarse para abrir un salón de belleza, compro los activos y los instalo en su casa, de esta manera tenía más tiempo para dedicar a su hogar y a la vez generar recursos. Julia tiene una amplia gama de servicios para el cuidado del cabello, masajes capilares, cortes de cabello, aplicación de tintes, blower entre otros.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos del barrio donde reside. Sus compras de productos capilares, las realiza a proveedores especializados y las cancela de contado, razón por la cual, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará tintes, masajes, shampoo, cremas y demás insumos para su negocio a precio especial.  Esta inversión permitirá que mejoren los inventarios de productos y con ello se pueda brindar un servicio más oportuno, lo que sería muye exitoso para su negocio.  Julia tiene 50 años y dos hijos de 27 y 24 años, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro,  aunque en su negocio su principal desafío sea la competencia ella entrega un toque personal a sus servicios para fidelizar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julia has a beauty salon in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  She started offering services at home, and little by little expanded her customer base.  Then she needed to start organizing herself to open a beauty salon.  She bought the fixed assets and set up in her home.  That way she had more time to devote to her household at the same time she was earning an income.

Julia offers a wide range of services, including hair care, scalp massage, haircuts, dyes, and blow drying.  Her main customers are neighbors and friends in the neighborhood where she lives.

She buys her hair products from specialized providers and pays in cash, which is why she's currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy dyes, massages, shampoo, creams, and other supplies for her business at special prices.  This investment will allow her to improve her product inventory and, with that, offer more timely service, which will be very successful for her business.

Julia is 50 years old and has two children, 27 and 24, whom she wants to give a better future.  Although her main challenge in her business is the competition, she offers a personal touch in her services to foster customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy dyes, massages, shampoo, creams, and other supplies for her business at a special price

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old and married with four children, who are all in school.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emily has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Emily aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 47 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Gregoria has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Gregoria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gregoria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Ailyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ailyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ailyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her fishing business like an ice box, a fishing net, and gasoline.

Marites has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like an ice box, a fishing net, and gasoline for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose tiene 29 años de edad tiene un hijo de 5 años vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Solicita el credito para la compra de insumos y para pagar del arriendo del terreno donde va a sembrar ya que no tiene terreno propio, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para ya no seguir arrendando, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades en los sembrios, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte .
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old, has one 5-year-old son, and lives in the Ventana province of los Rios. He makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and to pay the rent for the land where he is going to plant since he doesn't have his own land. His dream is to buy his own land to stop renting. The challenges he faces are diseases in the field. 

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to grow corn

loans.name: Sri

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Sri, a micro entrepreneur who lives in Cibubur, a suburban city located south of Jakarta. Sri is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with three children. Sri’s husband works on the staff of small company. To support her husband in fulfilling family needs, Sri is managing a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment service. Sri is the one who manages the stall on the daily basis. She joined Ruma about 1 1/2 years ago when she met a Ruma field staff member who introduced her to Ruma financial services. For the last three months, Sri has been performing well in providing mobile services in her community. She has an advantage to sell because her customers are mostly her neighbors who regularly come to her stall.
