As the business runs, she needs more working capital to process more transactions in her stall. Therefore, Sri is applying for a Kiva loan for the first time. In the future, Sri plans to add more products to sell, such as e-commerce for low-income communities. In the photo, Sri is in front of her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 8 years; 2 of whom go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. 

With the loan she has requested from Kiva's lenders, Odette would like to buy more maize fertilizers which she will sell. The profits from her business will be used to increase her family's standard of living.

As of 2009, the agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more maize fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Three years ago Grace started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sambirir, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kapsowar area. Grace has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market as demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry farm, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Grace can achieve their dreams and goals. Grace believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Shaaibu

texts.en:
Shaaibu is a maize farmer from Namadi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shaaibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shaaibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shaaibu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer from Mafera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Aminu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rufai

texts.en:
Rufai is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rufai would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rufai can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Rufai, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Makera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Iliya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en: Istifanus is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Istifanus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his children.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Médine un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Fatoumata  debout en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo fait le commerce d’habits à travers le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt un 30 pagne wax, 10 complets pour enfant. Elle s’approvisionne  à Bamako ainsi qu’à Sikasso. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme pour la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au niveau des services à travers la ville. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya’s four members are married women. They are on average 35, with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Medine, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (Mali’s third administrative region). This is their sixteenth solidarity loan with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Loans help them meet customer demand. 

In this group is Ms. Fatoumata, standing in first position from the right to the left in the photo. She trades in clothing. With her loan, she plans on purchasing thirty pieces of local “Wax” fabric and ten sets of children clothes. She procures her supplies from Bamako as well as Sikasso. In demand with her mostly-female clientele for the quality of her products, she sells for cash or extend credits. She retails from home and also provides service across the city.

She forecasts an average monthly profit of 35,000 XOF, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, with the rest going towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Seleman is in his late 40s, single, and the father of two adult children.  He has been selling charcoal for seven years now.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Seleman's 24th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the charcoal stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to buy a plot of land, paid school fees and covered household expenses. He has done fine with the loans and appreciates Kiva for its support. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal. He dreams of building his own house.

Seleman will share this loan with his loan group "Mpipi," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of  charcoal.

loans.name: Venezuela Group

texts.en:
Florah, who is in her mid forties, is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. One is grown-up and no longer in school. For three years now, she has been running several projects including a variety shop and a charcoal business.  She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Florah's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start a shop business and increase the stocks in it.  The business is now called a "gengeduka," which is a shop with several items including fruit,vegetables, dry food like rice, sugar, maize flour, baking powder, beans and salt.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, a television set, a deck, a sofa set and to pay for other household expenses.  She is doing great with the loan.  She will use this loan to restock her gengeduka store.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Florah will share this loan with her loan group, "VENEZUELA," which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in the gengeduka store.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 29-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he started repairing cars five years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Tareq is a hard worker and an ambitious man who succeeded with his proficiency to open his own auto repair shop a year ago to increase his income as he is trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions.  So, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house's roof and fix the wall's moisture issue in an attempt to provide his family with a better and healthy living place.

Tareq hopes to expand his business more in the future to stay capable of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house's roof and fix the wall's moisture issue

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a goal oriented woman. She was born in 1995. She is single and lives with her family. She is a well educated and industrious girl.  It is her second year of her education in university. University requests payments for tuition. Her family has not enough money now to pay her tuition. She does not want to miss her classes but needs financial support for paying tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un emprendedor hombre de 54 años de edad, se encuentra domiciliado en el municipio de Sabanalarga y es padre de tres hijos de 29, 32 y 33 años de edad,  él siempre le gustó la vida del campo, creció en una finca en donde aprendió los quehaceres de este lugar, actualmente se dedica a la producción y venta de queso y suero al por mayor, sus principales clientes son las tiendas de barrios y expendios que comercializan queso y suero, a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago, él inició su negocio en el año 1990 y con esta amplia experiencia y trayectoria, ha logrado fidelizar a sus clientes por el buen sabor y calidad en sus productos. Sus compras de insumos las realiza a fincas y cancela de contado o a crédito, Eduardo trabaja todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., él es muy responsable y dedicado con su negocio, puesto que desea cumplir con su meta familiar que es comprar una casa.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital que utilizará en la compra de insumos como leche y sal, para la preparación de sus productos. Esta inversión es muy oportuna por encontrarnos en la temporada navideña y sus productos son bastante apetecidos en las festividades que se celebran por estos días.
texts.en:
Eduardo is an enterprising man who is 54 years old. He resides in the town of Sabanalarga and has three adult children, who are ages 29, 32, and 33. He always enjoyed life in the country. He grew up on a farm where he learned the different jobs. He currently works making and selling wholesale cheese and whey. His main customers are the neighborhood stores and shops that sell cheese and whey. He offers them easy payment terms. 

He started his business in 1990, so he has ample experience. During his trajectory he has managed to establish a loyal customer base thanks to the high quality and flavor of his products. He buys his ingredients form nearby farms and pays in cash or on credit. Eduardo works every day and his schedule is from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. He is very responsible and dedicated to his business, because he wants to achieve his goal, which is to buy a house for his family. 

He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy ingredients  like milk and salt to prepare his products. The timing is perfect for this investment, since his products are in high demand for the holiday celebrations of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk and salt.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 52 years old, married and has four grown children and more than 20 years experience in this field. She earns enough money from her work to meet her needs, but wants to improve her business to generate more revenue. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Lydia hopes to make her business more successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en: Sabohat is married. She is a responsible mother of two children. Sabohat is a seamstress. She sews a variety of women's clothes to local people and has worked in this way for more than eight years. Sabohat’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia and so, Sabohat manages with household alone. She has been building a new house for many years but has not got enough money to finish the building of her house. She is asking for a loan of 13,000 Somoni to buy wood and slate to make the roof for her new house. This will allow her to offer a good living standard for her family. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy wood and slate to make the roof of her new house

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina is fifty-two years old and a single mother of five children.  She has a tailoring business and has been running this business for three years. It has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to buy sewing materials, thread and buttons for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to expand her business as well as repaying the loan. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In future she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials, thread and buttons

loans.name: Bugambilias Group

texts.es:
Bugambilias lleva por nombre un grupo consolidado en una comunidad ubicada en la parte alta de la sierra. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la venta de hojas de plátano, corte y venta de café. Cabe mencionar que la vista que ofrece la comunidad es muy agradable, al igual que el clima frío que predomina todo el año, el nombre del grupo se debe a que en casa de una de las integrantes hay muchas bugambilias de diferentes colores. Las personas que conforman el grupo y sus actividades son:

Blanca –Venta De Refrescos Y Dulces 
Catalina -Venta De Cafe Por Bolsa
María - Venta De Tamales
Alberta - Venta De Tamales
Eusebia -Venta De Dulces Y Frituras
Eduardo –Vente De Hoja Maicera
Maria De Los Angeles -Venta De Ropa
Flautila -Venta De Pan

Eduardo es un joven de 21 años, todos le conocen como Lalo, aun vive con su madre a quien apoya económicamente, con algunas labores del hogar y vendiendo pan por las tardes. Desde hace un año Eduardo ha hecho buen uso de una porción de tierra ubicada detrás de la casa de su tío donde ha sembrado cerca de 100 plantas maiceras que vende por mayoreo. Eduardo debe mantener las plantas en las mejores condiciones para que crezcan más rápido, debe limpiar con azadón las malas hierbas que nacen y para ello ha implementado la siembra de frijol ejotero que proporciona más nutrientes al suelo. Los días de corte, comienza la actividad muy temprano antes de que comience el calor en el ambiente para que las hojas se mantengan frescas. Al año, Eduardo vende cerca de tres millares de hojas que se utilizan normalmente para crear arreglos florales. Sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir algunos gastos de la casa e invierte en la compra de plantas para incrementar su producción. 

Recientemente, Eduardo ha estado ahorrando un poco de dinero para tener un pequeño invernadero y sembrar más plantas, pero por lo tanto, necesita más capital para comprar 50 plantas y por esto ha solicitado un préstamo a VisionFund México. “Espero  continuar con mi actividad, obtener ganancias y estudiar la universidad los fines de semana”.
 
El grupo agradece a VisionFund y kiva por el apoyo económico que les servirá para mejorar cada una de sus actividades y su calidad de vida. 

*La fotografía se capturó en las piedras donde nace el agua que consumen los integrantes del grupo y algunos vecinos. Esta fuente está protegida por una pequeña casa. Eduardo es el único integrante hombre del grupo.
texts.en:
Bugambilias lleva por nombre un grupo consolidado en una comunidad ubicada en la parte alta de la sierra. La mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la venta de hojas de plátano, corte y venta de café. Cabe mencionar que la vista que ofrece la comunidad es muy agradable, al igual que el clima frío que predomina todo el año, el nombre del grupo se debe a que en casa de una de las integrantes hay muchas bugambilias de diferentes colores. Las personas que conforman el grupo y sus actividades son:

Blanca –Venta De Refrescos Y Dulces 
Catalina -Venta De Cafe Por Bolsa
María - Venta De Tamales
Alberta - Venta De Tamales
Eusebia -Venta De Dulces Y Frituras
Eduardo –Vente De Hoja Maicera
Maria De Los Angeles -Venta De Ropa
Flautila -Venta De Pan

Eduardo es un joven de 21 años, todos le conocen como Lalo, aun vive con su madre a quien apoya económicamente, con algunas labores del hogar y vendiendo pan por las tardes. Desde hace un año Eduardo ha hecho buen uso de una porción de tierra ubicada detrás de la casa de su tío donde ha sembrado cerca de 100 plantas maiceras que vende por mayoreo. Eduardo debe mantener las plantas en las mejores condiciones para que crezcan más rápido, debe limpiar con azadón las malas hierbas que nacen y para ello ha implementado la siembra de frijol ejotero que proporciona más nutrientes al suelo. Los días de corte, comienza la actividad muy temprano antes de que comience el calor en el ambiente para que las hojas se mantengan frescas. Al año, Eduardo vende cerca de tres millares de hojas que se utilizan normalmente para crear arreglos florales. Sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir algunos gastos de la casa e invierte en la compra de plantas para incrementar su producción. 

Recientemente, Eduardo ha estado ahorrando un poco de dinero para tener un pequeño invernadero y sembrar más plantas, pero por lo tanto, necesita más capital para comprar 50 plantas y por esto ha solicitado un préstamo a VisionFund México. “Espero  continuar con mi actividad, obtener ganancias y estudiar la universidad los fines de semana”.
 
El grupo agradece a VisionFund y kiva por el apoyo económico que les servirá para mejorar cada una de sus actividades y su calidad de vida. 

*La fotografía se capturó en las piedras donde nace el agua que consumen los integrantes del grupo y algunos vecinos. Esta fuente está protegida por una pequeña casa. Eduardo es el único integrante hombre del grupo.

loans.use: comprara 50 plantas de hojas maiceras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks,  etc. (for a fishing business) and additional stock for her store, like canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Nurşen

texts.en:
Nurşen is married and the mother of four children. She has earned a living for the last four years by selling socks and nylons to neighbors and friends. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. Her children have married but she plans to work as long as she is well because she wants to avoid sitting idly at home and would like to contribute to her family and children. She is a successful and ambitious woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nurşen Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Beş yıldır çorap ve tayt satışı yapıyor.  Çevresine ve mahalleleri dolaşarak satışını gerçekleştiriyor.  Aldığı kredi ile çeşitli çoraplar ve tayt alacak.  Çocuklarını evlendirmiş evde boş durmamak ailesine çocuklarına katkı sağlamak için sağlığı el verdikçe işini devam ettirmeyi düşünüyor.  Nurşen Hanım başarılı  ve hırslı bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy socks and nylons.

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is married with two children. She has done hairdressing for 26 years and owns her own shop. Belkis enjoys her work and says her business is in a good place. 

Belkis is requesting a loan to buy needed materials at wholesale prices. In the future, she wants to have a hairdressing assistant and teach her the profession. Belkis wants to help people learn professional skills.

loans.use: to buy haidressing materials wholesale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Emily, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 26 years of age, very hardworking, and a go-getter. She is a proud mother of three lovely children. She hails from Moiben, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Emily has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Emily passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Tuyai” (this is from a person’s name), and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. She is contented with the farming way of life. Her biggest challenge in farming is irrigating her farm. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a generator that she will use in pumping water from the river to her farm. Irrigation is used to assist in the growing of agricultural crops, maintenance of landscapes, and re-vegetation of disturbed soils in dry areas and during periods of inadequate rainfall. 

Through this loan, she will be able to double her crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, she will be able to support her family and keep up with her rising family expenses. Emily patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a generator to be used for irrigation

loans.name: Ado Wakili

texts.en: Ado Wakili is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to pay for his immediate needs in cash. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ado Wakili can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Ado Wakili expressed a desire to use the extra income from postponing his harvest to provide food and clothing for his family. In the long run, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing and eliminate the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yesenia Cesibel

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija quien es la motivación de levantarse a a trabajar cada día. 

Yesenia, vive con sus padres, quienes tienen un negocio de elaboración de teja.- Ella vende artículos y productos de belleza desde hace 5 años y tambien posee una tienda que su mamá administra.

Cesibel, actualmente se dedica a la administración de la elaboración de tejas, tiene dos años de experiencia en esta actividad.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar de materiales para la elaboración de teja y para el pago de mano de obra de los trabajadores. 

Con esta inversión busca incrementar la producción y así tener mejores ingresos.

Su principal sueño es, retomar sus estudios en la carrera de administración de empresas, ya que esto le ayudará en el manejo del negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 25 years old, is a single mother and has one daughter who is her motivation to get out of bed and work every day.

Yesenia lives with her parents, who have a tile-making business. She has sold  beauty items and products for the past 5 years and she also has a store that her mother runs. 

Cesibel currently makes a living running the tile-making, she has two years of experience in this activity.

She will invest the loan in materials to make tiles and to pay for the handiwork of the workers. 

With this investment she looks to increase the production and in that way have better income. 

Her main dream is to return to her studies in business administration, since this will help her in the management of her family's business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the porcino of tile and to pay for the handiwork of the workers

loans.name: Marino Adilio

texts.es:
Marino, de 28 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que día a día, busca siempre la forma de que no le falte el sustento a su familia; está acompañado, tiene un a niña de 3 años y su compañera de vida tiene una pequeña tienda.

Debido a la situación de pobreza, decidió emigrar a Estados Unidos, estuvo trabajando durante un tiempo y con los recursos que consiguió, compró una maquina desgranadora de maíz; pero luego fue deportado y tuvo que regresar a El Salvador. 

Con el dinero que ahorro pudo establecer una pequeña tienda; él se encarga de manejar la maquina desgranadora en esta época de cosecha en la zona.

Marino, necesita el dinero para comprar una pieza del motor de la maquina desgranadora, ya que se le ha dañado.

Él desea aprovechar está época cuando hay más demanda de este servicio, para obtener ingresos.

Su sueño, es tener un taller de mecánica, ya que ha podido observar que hay una buena oportunidad de negocio en este rubro.
texts.en:
Marino is 28 years old. He is a young entrepreneur who everyday is looking for ways to better support his family. He lives with his 3 year old daughter and life partner, who has a small shop.

Due to poverty, he decided to emigrate to the United States where he worked for a while. With the money he earned, he bought a corn husking machine. Later he was deported and had to return to El Salvador.

With the money that he saved he set up a small shop. He is responsible for managing the corn husking machine during this time of harvest for the area.

Marino needs money to purchase a part for the motor on the corn husking machine, since is is damaged.

He would like to take advantage of this time of the season when there is more demand for this service, in order to obtain income.

His dream is to have a machine workshop since he has observed there is a good business opporunity in this area.

loans.use: to buy a component for the motor of his husking machine.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer casada de 46 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Solola, tiene 7 hijos dentro de ellos 2 son pequeños.

Manuela es una mujer que busca la manera de cómo apoyar a su familia para la generación de ingresos,  pues ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y otros artículos siempre relacionado con lo típico, ella vende en su comunidad, y sale a vender también a orillas del hermoso lago que es Panajachel, ella es una mujer muy reconocida por su tipo de trabajo, Manuela quiere seguir con esta actividad, pero para eso ella necesita de un capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, ella ahora busca un préstamo para adquirir capital, ya esta venta le ha ayudado a generar un poco de ingresos a su familia, así también apoyo a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando. 

Manuela es una mujer que sueña agrandar su negocio, cada día pero el recurso mas difícil es el dinero, pero tiene la seguridad de conseguir este préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 46 year old married woman. She lives in the community of Solola. She has 7 children and 2 of them are young.

Manuela is a woman searching for a way to generate income to support her family, so then she works selling traditional clothing and other related traditional items. She sells in her community and she also sells on the beautiful beaches at Panajachel. She is a well known woman because of her type of work. Manuela wants to continue with this activity, but to do it she needs working capital to continue investing in her business. She is now looking for a loan to acquire capital, as this trade has helped her generate a bit of income for her family as well as also allowing her children to stay in school. 

Manuela is a woman who dreams of making her business larger but each day the hardest resource to get is money, but with this loan she has that assurance.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario earns a living by raising and selling hogs. He is a 29-year-old single man living in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. He has been raising hogs for four years now. Aside from that, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling various items like noodles, canned goods, shampoo, biscuits and other goods.

He is in need of financial support to continue his present livelihood. Mario is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store like biscuits, toiletries, beverages and canned goods. These supplies are his method to attract more consumers. Making his store filled with variety of stocks will slowly improve his earnings, thus starting to pay for the loan and other daily expenses.



Mario is hoping that someday he could improve his both business to successful in life and hopefully this is the start of his progress for recovery.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for his store like biscuits, toiletries, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.en:
Subhon is a strong-willed man. He was born in 1994. He is married. His wife is a housekeeper. He graduated high school in 2012. He studied well at school. He is a useful and friendly person. He feels responsibility for family and community. 

After graduating high school he entered university. He studies part time. He makes good progress in university. 

This year his family did not have enough money to pay for his education. He is asking for financial support for paying tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: Sohiba was born in 1981 in Tajikistan. She has grown up in this country and loves Tajikistan very much. Sohiba has "golden hands." She makes a variety of women clothes and offers her services to local people. Sohiba has worked in this way more than four years. She always cares for the health of her children. She wants buy a milk cow and every day to offer her children milk. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a milk cow. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is an honest woman. She is married and has four children. She has her own business deal growing crops, vegetables and animal husbandry. Jamila mainly grows potatoes and wheat. She works hard every day on her land and her husband helps her to grow potatoes and wheat and sell them. Jamila always tries to help her children to get a good education. She is asking for a loan because she must pay tuition for her child at the university. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her child.

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien is 42 years old. He is married with one child who is 15 years old and goes to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 13 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers of maize for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy maize fertilizers for resale.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en: Alhasan is a maize farmer from Kwabo Wambai village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhasan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhasan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alhasan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn engages in a rice vending business. She sells rice to the locals in her community on a retail basis. To augment with an additional income, she also sells fresh fish. She is a resident in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 46-year-old married woman with four kids. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 4.

Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy additional varieties of fresh fish to resell. She can purchase and sell more fresh fish in the market.  She could now start investing in other possible business ventures that could help her gain additional income. Eventually, Marlyn's earnings will grow and she can now probably afford to buy nutritious food for the whole family.
   
She is determined that she would try her best to handle her business to be productive to be able support the schooling of all her children. And besides, she would be able to provide her children with better living condition as well.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Andresabel

texts.en:
This is Andresabel, 42, a resident of Tanza Cavite, Philippines. Married to German, she is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and the school needs of her children.

Andresabel makes and sells native delicacies like rice cakes. These are commonly eaten for snacks and also for desserts. She sells them per order and on demand on special occasions and holidays. She also sells and distributes water in her community, which is shown in her photo. She also has a small store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan which she will use to buy the raw ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar, coconut milk and partly to pay for gallons of water. She is positive for a good turnout of her business. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Andresabel aims to grow her business and dreams of owning a vehicle to easily transport her rice cakes and water in her town. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sticky rice, coconut milk and charcoal to make and sell rice cakes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old, married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children. He does farming in Thika town and he has been in this business for the past five years. He also has a motorcycle transport business. 

Charles plans to use this loan to boost his farming by buying seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs. 

This is Charles' third loan from VisionFund Kenya and he successfully paid his previous loans. His future hopes are to grow his farming business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy suigar, flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en: Jihan is a single "special needs" woman from Iraq. She is thirty-eight years old and lives with her sister, who runs a small tailoring workshop at home.  Jihan became a seamstress and has worked with her sister since 2007. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child and she started sewing clothes to make a living. She has good experience in this field and a good reputation in her area. Jihan is requesting a loan of 2,825 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine and a small generator. Through this loan, she believes that she will start her own business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Angel Gregorio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 39 años de edad tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 13 años es viudo y vive en Ventanas provincia de Bolivar.

solicita el credito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes agricolas garcias al credito va a poder realizar los cultivos y mejorarlos para obtener una ganancia buena y sustentar a sus hijos, los dasafios a los que se enfrenta es las plagas en los cultivos y perder todo, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer recuerdos de fomix para vender y se dedica a sus hijos
texts.en:
Angel is 39 years old and has three children ages 15, 14, and 13. He is a widower and lives in the Ventanas province of Bolivar.

He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers. Thanks to the loan he will be able to have a crop and improve it in order to make a good profit and support his children. 

The challenges he faces are infestations in the crops that cause him to lose everything. In his free time he likes to make and sell Fomix mementos and devote himself to his children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: El Madroño Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres alegres (Zilka Patricia, Angelina y Ana Karina) de la ciudad de Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada, calzado y productos de belleza; se organizaron hace dos meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Ana Karina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven amable de 23 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos: El mayor de 7 años de edad, estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Su esposo cuenta con una experiencia de 8 años de  trabajar como conductor de taxi. Ella, desde hace 1 año estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Masaya calzado y venderlos a precios accesibles  en la ciudad de Bilwi. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero
texts.en: This consolidated group is formed of three joyful women (Zilka Patricia, Angelina, and Anna Karina) from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who struggle day after day to grow their small retail businesses of used clothing, footwear, and beauty products. They organized themselves two months ago to access joint-guaranteed loans in Pana Pana. Ana Karina is the coordinator of this group, she is a kind 23 years old young lady, married with 2 boys. Her 7 year old son is in first grade, and the youngest son is 3 years old. Her husband has worked for the past 8 years as a taxi driver. A year ago, she started her small retail business of shoe sales. She is asking her first loan to buy Masaya footwear and to sell them at affordable prices in the city of Bilwi. She dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase Masaya footwear

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 36-year-old married woman, and a mother of six children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been providing services of flour grinding in his community. Over time he has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of his family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Nadia has availed Murabaha of Rs. 25,000 PKR for her husband. 

It would help him to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir, age 56, is a married woman. One of her sons is also show in the photo. He provides painting services in his locality, and earns sufficient amount of income to bear the family expenditures. 

For the improvement of her son’s business, Zahir has sought Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to purchase buckets of paints in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum customers to increase income.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of paints in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals, with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Jamila needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a widow and the mother of four children. One of her sons, who is also shown in the photo, started van driving business some time ago. He earns good amount of income and needs some financial help to pay for the repair and maintenance costs of the vehicle. 

Therefore, Abida has availed Murabaha of 30,000 PKR loan for her son. She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the vehicle.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing agriculture work for some years. He grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market.  He makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Shahida has applied for a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to buy different types of seeds, along with insecticide and pesticide, to grow more crops which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy for her husband's business different types of seeds, along with insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Yasemen

texts.en:
Yasemen is married with two children. 

Seven months ago she followed her mother-in-law’s example and began selling Tupperware. She sells to her friends and in her mother’s neighborhood. Since she is new to this business, she is progressing slowly. She wants to become a group leader and increase her sales. 

She’ll use the loan to buy more products to sell.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Yasemen hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Yedi ay önce kayınvalidesinden örnek alarak evine katkı sağlamak için tupperware satmaya başlamış.  Kendi çevresine ve annesinin mahallesinde satış yapıyor.  Daha çok yeni olduğundan yavaş yavaş ilerliyor.  Grup lideri olmak ve satışlarını arttırmak istiyor.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün alacak.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Beatrice is blessed with four children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm she grows maize, and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize, and when she is not farming, Beatrice offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. To meet her expenses and provide for her family, she also often engages in small personal business to make extra money. Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Beatrice said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means  business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Beatrice  formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful), which produces milk daily that Beatrice sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not really affected by sudden changes in the weather, if you have stored feed," said Beatrice. 

The money Beatrice earned from selling her milk was sufficient to repay her last loan. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Beatrice is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, with good health and a good livelihood. Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tuğba

texts.en:
Tuğba is married. She has done hairdressing for 11 years, and she’s had her own shop for five.

She heard about microlending from a friend. She’ll use the loan to buy materials wholesale. She wants to expand her store and buy new equipment, and she’ll take out another loan for this.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Tuğba Hanım evli.  On bir yıldır kuaförlük yapıyor.  Beş yıldır kendi dükkanını işletiyor.  Mikro krediyi arkadaşından duymuş .  Toplu malzeme almak için kredi kullandı.  İleride dükkanını genişletmek ve eşyalarını yenilemek istiyor.  Bunu da yeniden mikro kredi kullanarak yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses like medication, special examination, and payment of college.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir is a goal-oriented man. He lives in a rural area and is a single student, in his first year of study at a university. His dream is to be a teacher. He feels a responsibility to the community and wants to be helpful to others. He helps his parents in their business. As his parents are not able to pay his university tuition, Sobir is asking for financial support to pay for it.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Don Pascual Mero  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Don Pascual Mero se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio los Esteros en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo  atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Glenda, tiene 30 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 7 años, los menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Glenda con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y bisuterías), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y la mayoría de sus ventas son bajo pedidos. Trabaja tres o cuatro días por semana en sus ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y productos Avon. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo  y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo
texts.en:
The "Don Pascual Mero" communal bank meets every 15 days in the "Los Esteros" neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which receive many visitors at all times of year. It is also known as a uniquely beautiful city with many tourist attractions. 

This is a group of people who decided some time ago to join together to form this communal bank, which has helped them greatly to expand their businesses. They work in diverse fields, such as general merchandise, food sales, and services, among other activities. 

One of the members of this group is Glenda. She is 30 years old and has a common-law husband. From this relationship she has three children, aged 15, 12 and 7. The younger children are in primary and secondary school. Her husband is a mechanic. 

With the aim of earning something on her own and helping her household get ahead, Glenda works selling clothing of all types as well as Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry). Her sales method is from door to door, and most of her sales consist of orders. She works three or four days each week on her sales and collections, since she sells on credit and collects payments every fifteen days. She has dedicated herself to this work for more than 10 years, and it helps her earn something for her family's well-being. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and Avon products. This is her third loan cycle within the communal bank. She is the one who supervises the group's payments, and she likes the group because the loans have helped her greatly with her business. Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

The small photo shows a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Nekiremu

texts.en:
Nekiremu is 41 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. He does livestock trading in Narok town and has been in this business for 15 years. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of goats to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more goats to sell. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals and ground nuts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Erlinda de 26  años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene 02 hijos que depende de ambos y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de verduras y abarrotería.
Doña Erlinda está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra huevos, manteca, harina, frescos, pollo, plásticos, aceites, plátanos, cebolla, lechuga, etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Erlinda espera con esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio ya que tiene bastante demanda para esta época de navidad, espera también mejorar sus ingresos, uno de sus su sueños es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda is 26 years old. Along with her husband and their two dependent sons, they live in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley south of Honduras. She does not own her home,  and for the past 5 years she has worked in vegetable and grocery retail sales. Mrs. Erlinda is asking for a loan to purchase eggs, lard, flour, fresh produce, chicken, plastics, oils, plantains, onions, lettuce, etc. She is a hard working woman with a great desire to succeed. With this investment, Mrs. Erlinda hopes to get ahead in her retail business because she has great demand during Christmas time. She also hopes to improve her earnings, as one of her dreams is to have her own home. San Lorenzo, Honduras December 2014.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, lard, flour, fresh produce, chicken, plastics, oils, plantains, onions, lettuce. etc for her retail store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en:
Albanus is a 36-year-old married man. He and his spouse have been blessed with 3 children. He does farming in Thika-Town, where he grows maize, beans, and vegetables for sale. His business has been profitable. He also has a hotel business.

Albanus plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will also buy food stock, such as maize flour and cereals, for use in his hotel business. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful, and to make more income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Zarmina

texts.en:
Zarmina is a 38-year-old married woman who, for many years, has been selling animals with the help of her husband (shown in the photo with her). Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

Zarmina is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

For the improvement of her business she has sought a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en:
Suryia has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more stocks of grocery items, such as grains, sugar and cleaning products. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery items such as grains, sugar and cleaning products.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 30-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of animal selling and milk selling along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She owns two cows. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her fourth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that the increase in business will help her in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, es ama de casa y no estudio porque en la comunidad donde ella vivía no había un centro educativo donde ella pudiera estudiar, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 41, 32 y 30 años de edad, los cuales ya todos están casados y trabajan para sus hogares, por lo tanto nadie depende de ella.

María, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón desde hace 2 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la situación económica que estaba pasando y al vender ese producto ella obtendría un poco de ingresos para el sustento diario.

Para realizar la venta de semilla de marañon María, lo hace en su casa en el horario de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. todos los días.

El préstamo que está solicitando en la institución es para comprar de una vaca lechera, con la cual espera poder tener un poco más de ingresos.

Los sueño de María, es tener una granja de cerdos de engorde, mejorar su vivienda ya que está un poco dañada y tener 4 vacas lecheras.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and a housewife. She did not attend school, because in the community where she lived there was no school. She is a single mom of 3 children who are 41, 32 and 30 years old, all of whom are married and work for their families. Therefore, no one depends on her. Maria has worked for 2 years selling cashew nuts. She learned this job, because of the financial situation she was going through, and by selling this product she would obtain more income for her daily subsistence. Maria sells cashew nuts in her home from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day. She is requesting a loan in the institution to buy a dairy cow. With it she hopes to have some more income. Maria's dreams are to have a farm with pigs to fatten, to improve her house because it is a little damaged, and to have four dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles and his wife have worked on their current farm, situated in the outskirts of Kapsowar town, Kenya, since 2008. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise, and also the maize and vegetables they grow. 

Charles has further invested in transportation services to reduce their transportation costs, and make money offering the service to other farmers. Charles loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm’s success to date happen. 

Charles is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market are really growing diverse in Kenya. Taking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass; we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. Today, milk consumers are spoiled for choice: in the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice, and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Charles to pick these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product qualities adapt to the changes in consumer preference. Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Charles is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and the milk quality is second to none in the market. 

He anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This, to him, is accepted because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly. Your loan will make a significant difference to Charles's farm profitability. The couple will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education, and the rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their four children. They hope the kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree cow

loans.name: Angie Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por 2 mujeres y un hombre emprendedor (Bielka Victoria, Yaneth y Benjamin), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 4 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.


Bielka Victoria: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que cursa su primaria. Su esposo es taxista. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos como arroz, aceite, jabón, está solicitando  financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, huevo, pan, chiverías, papel higiénico, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
This mixed solidarity group is made up of 2 female and one male entrepreneur (Biela Victoria, Yaneth, and Benjamin) They live in the city of Bilwi and they united 4 months ago with the purpose of working together to be able to gain access to loans from Pana Pana in order to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, improve their incomes, and in this way improve the quality of life of their families.

Bielka Victoria: She is the coordinator of the solidarity group, is a fighting woman, 32 years old, married with an 8-year-old son who is in primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. With the objective of having her own source of income, 3 years ago she set up a small grocery store where she sells basic products such as rice, oil, soap. 

She is asking for funding to purchase: basic grains, eggs, bread, Chiverías (dairy/yogurt brand), toilet paper, and sodas, among other products. 

She dreams of coming to have her own large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, oil, soap

loans.name: Julia Lorena

texts.es: Julia es una señora de profesión maestra de educación primaria, que labora en un colegio de la zona donde vive, con 16 años, es casada con un hijo a su cargo el que le da el apoyo para su desarrollo, esta señora se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en  la compra de zinc, perlin y  mano de obra, con los que mejoraría el techo y de esa manera mejorara las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Julia is a woman who is a primary school teacher by profession. She works in a school in the area where she lives. She married at the age of 16 and has one child in her care, to whom she provides the support he needs for his development. She came to Ceprodel to apply for a loan which she will use to buy metal sheets and framing boards and to pay for labor. With these she will improve her roof and thus improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and framing boards and pay for labor to improve her roof.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region. She has no higher education and since getting married she became engaged in farming since she became the wife of very skilled young farmer, who despite of his age, was already a prosperous farmer. 

Nvard now runs farming alone and manages all the work around it perfectly. In her farm she has three cows, two calves, a bull, a pig, three sheep and 10 chickens. Her farm products are milk, meat, and eggs that she sells right from her house.  On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes for which resellers give her a good price. 

Nvard has plans connected with her farm in which she hopes Kiva lenders will support her; she asks this loan in order to buy a calf and animal fodder for winter's long and cold months.

loans.use: to buy a calf and animal fodder for winter's long and cold months

loans.name: Kigando Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Robert is a member of Kigando Abeteraine Group, where each member guarantees the other to obtain a loan. He is a retailer selling general merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil and salt, to mention but a few.

His major challenge is weather changes, which make roads impassable when he is coming from buying stock for his business, and customers delay to pay him. However, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning.

Robert has asked for a loan to stock his shop with sugar, cooking oil, salt, and Blue Band to sell.

loans.use: to stock his shop with sugar, cooking oil, salt and Blue Band to sell.

loans.name: Sokome

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet Sokome, a Maasai woman. She is a smallholder farmer from Sambirir in Kapsowar, Kenya. She is a mother of two: one son and one daughter. 

Like many farmers in the region, she has a dairy cow. Kapsowar has a thriving market for dairy products. Sokome has sustained herself through dairy farming for seven years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes so deep that she even names each of them. 

She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Sokome is borrowing KES 52,750 to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more milk for both consumption and sales. 

With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Sokome plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Sokome will not have to take such measures. 

In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living. Sokome is happy for Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava is married with four children who are in high school and college. 

To provide for her family and her children’s schooling she started to sell Tupperware 7.5 years ago. She likes the work, and sales and profits are good. 

With her second loan, she’ll buy promotional items and raise her profits. She wants to double her income. Her only goal is for her children to complete their educations.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Hava Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Çocukları üniversite ve lise eğitimine devam ediyor.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için tupperware  satmaya başlıyor.  Yedi buçuk yıldır bu işi yapıyor.  Yaptığı işten memnun ,satışları ve kazancı iyi.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile promosyonlu ürün çekip satışını arttırmak,kazancını ikiye katlamak istiyor.  Tek amacı çocuklarının eğitimlerini tamamlaması.

loans.use: to buy promotional items and raise her profits

loans.name: Muhtorjon

texts.ru: Мухтор мужчина  в возрасте 35 лет. Родился в семье дехканина.Женат, имеет 3-х детей.Несмотря на свой молодой  возраст он очень трудолюбивый.С юных лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз.культур и откормом скота.Дома откармливает скот и продает на скотный рынок.Ему помогает жена.Семья очень трудолюбивая.Каждый кусочек хлеба они зарабатывают с трудом.Его жена колхозница,чтобы прокормить свою семью она вынуждена работать на поле и пасти скот на пастбище.А молоко коровы она продает в продовольственный рынок.Мухтор живет со своими родителями,они пенсионеры ,чтобы содержать свою семью в достатке он вынужден еще работать разнорабочим.Мухтор хочет получить кредит для покупки скота ,так как цена на скот  очень низкая в зимний период. Он благодарен организации Арванд и надеется на  поддержку.
texts.en: Muhtor is 35 years old and was born in a dekhan farmer family. He is married and has 3 children. Despite his young age, he is very hardworking. Since a young age, he has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up of livestock. He fattens up livestock at home and sells it at a livestock market. His wife helps him. His family is very hardworking. They earn each slice of bread with hard work. His wife is a farmer and has to work in the field and take livestock to a pasture in order to feed her family. And she sells cow milk at a food market. Muhtor lives with his parents, who are retired, and, in order to provide for the family, he has to also work as a handyman. Muhtor wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock because livestock price is very low in the winter. He is grateful to the Arvand organization and relies on the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es: El muchacho Henry nació en una comunidad llamada el sardinal en el año de 1986. Henry estudio en la escuela de la comunidad estudio toda su primaria, el se siente bien que pudo medio estudiar ya que sabe poco pero sabe leer y escribir. Después que dejo de estudiar decidió ayudarle al padre a cultivar la tierra y así fue que aprendió las labores de campo. Henry vivió con sus padres hasta la edad de 25 años ya que conoció a la muchacha Griselda y decidió unirse con ella. Actualmente Henry trabaja en agricultura el comenta que su padre le dio un pedazo de tierra para que trabajara y el decidió sembrarla de café y otra parte de tierra  que él la ha comprado poco a poco y también la tiene sembrado de café y también tiene área en donde siembra granos básicos para consumo y para venta el café que está cosechando lo cosecha con su señora. El comenta que con esfuerzo pudo hacer su casa que es humilde pero que es propia y es ahí donde vivirán sus hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar sus cosas pero comenta que actualmente en la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y que es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder alumbrarse por las noches y así ya va a poder vivir un poco mas diferente con su esposa y cuando ya vengan los niños la señora podrá  atenderlos con luz producida por el panel solar, el comenta que estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en: Henry was born in a community called El Sardinal in 1986. Henry studied at the school in his community and completed primary school. He is glad that he was able to complete half his education, since he knows little but he can read and write. After he left school, he decided to help his father cultivate the land, and that is how he learned farm work. Henry lived with his parents until the age of 25, since he met Griselda and decided to marry her. Currently Henry works in agriculture. He notes that his father gave him a piece of land for him to work and he decided to plant coffee on it. He has coffee planted on another piece of land that he has bought little by little and he also has an area where he grows staple grains to consume and sell. He harvests the coffee he is harvesting with his wife. He notes that with effort he was able to build his house, which is humble but his own and is where his children will live. With a lot of effort he has been able to buy his things but he notes that currently in the community there is no electric light. That is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy a solar energy system and in this way be able to have light at night and be able to live a bit differently with his wife. When the children arrive she will be able to attend to them with light produced by the solar panel. He notes that he would be very grateful if he were provided with the opportunity of this loan to buy this solar energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Audu Malam

texts.en:
Audu Malam is a maize farmer from Furana village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Audu Malam would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Audu Malam can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Audu Malam, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Supartini

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Supartini, a micro entrepreneur who lives in Depok. Depok is a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. Supartini is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with a son. Supartini's husband is a home-tailor. His monthly wage covers just enough for the family’s needs, but it leaves them no money left for saving. 

Therefore, Supartini and her husband are managing a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment service. Supartini is the one who manages the stall on a daily basis. She started selling mobile airtime about three months ago, when she met a Ruma field staff who introduced her to Ruma. For the last three months, Sri has been performing well in providing mobile services in her community. She has an advantage to sell because her customers are mostly her neighbors who regularly come to her stall. 

As the business runs, she needs working capital in order to process more transactions in her stall. Therefore, Supartini is applying for a Kiva loan for the first time. 

In the future, Supartini plans to add more products to the things she sells, such as e-commerce for low income communities. In the photo, Supartini is in front of her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Philibus Namama

texts.en:
Philibus Namama is a maize farmer.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus Namama would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus Namama can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Philibus Namama is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dominic Habu

texts.en:
Dominic Habu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dominic Habu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Clement, Malki-Sadic, and Ummi.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dominic Habu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dominic Habu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Dominic Habu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 34-year-old married man; he has two kids.

He works in the shop as a seller; his monthly income is 130 manat. Ramil has a hard position because this money does not solve his family problems. 
Also he has a garden, but there is not enough water to grow trees or vegetables. If he realizes his plan, his life will change.

Ramil needs to buy a water pump to irrigate his garden

This is his first loan. Ramil applied for 1,000 AZN.  Please support him.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his garden

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa de 68  años de edad, vive con su esposo, no  tiene  hijos que depende de ella y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Luisa se dedica desde hace 07 años  a la venta medicina natural y también vende pescado y miel de abeja, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como te, manzanilla, rábano, especias, pastillas naturales, etc.  Para surtir su negocio ya que tiene bastante demanda para esta época de navidad porque también vende frutas como uvas y manzanas. Con el apoyo del crédito espera surtir más su negocio y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña Luisa está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Luisa, 68, lives with her husband and none of her children are dependent. She lives in a village in San Lorenzo in the southern valley of Honduras. 

For the past seven years, Luisa has been selling natural medicine as well as fish and honey.
