She is requesting the loan to buy more products such as tea, chamomile, radish, spices, natural pills, etc. to stock her store. She has sufficient demand during Christmas time, because she also sells fruit such as grapes and apples. 

With help from the loan, she hopes to stock her store more so that she can increase her income. Luisa is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to improve her store and her home.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  December 2014.

loans.use: to buy chamomile, radish, spices, natural pills, etc for her store.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a responsible woman. She is married and has a little child who is 2 years old. Farzona is a sewer, and she has been busy with this business for more than 4 years.

Farzona mainly sews fashionable dresses for women. She is going to increase her business and maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 300 USD to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Abdel Khaleq

texts.en:
Abdel Khalek is a 27-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. He studied law at the university, and took the official training and he now has a law office in the city. 

Abdel would like to improve his business and gain more experience to attract more clients.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his law business. 

By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to organize his business electronically, and contact clients and other partners by email. This will make his job easier. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his law business.

loans.name: Sandji's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Les sous  groupes qui le composent sont très dynamique dans le secteur du petit commerce et font preuves d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

Madame Sandji (debout à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme qui a su au fil des cycles accroître son commerce de  vente de produits  locaux (savon traditionnel, huile de palme, miel, pain de singe, savon traditionnel). Elle tient une table au marché depuis plus d’une décennie et jouit d’une très grande expérience dans le petit commerce.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte s’approvisionner pour 120 kg de « khémé » produit chimique pour la fabrication de savon et divers autres produits intermédiaires.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne et mieux assister son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par l’achat de fournitures scolaires et de nourriture.
texts.en:
Created on 13th December 2003, this banc villageois groups together women who share the ideal that everyone must place themselves in the service of their society and, more importantly, their family. The sub-groups which make up this larger one are very dynamic in the retail sector and offer solidarity and mutual support to its members. These woman all live within the same local area and earn a living through retail.

Sandji (the woman standing to the right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. Over the course of many loan cycles, she has learned how to grow her business. Her venture sells local products such as traditionally-made soaps, palm oil, honey and the fruit of the baobab tree, which is also known as monkey bread. She has run her own market stall for over 10 years and has a great deal of experience in this area.

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing 120 kilos of "khémé", a chemical product used in the fabrication of soap and various other items.

She is planning on using the profits to bolster her savings and provide her husband with additional assistance when it comes to their family's expenses, such as buying school supplies and food.

loans.use: to purchase 120 kilos of "khémé", a chemical product used in the fabrication of soap and various other items

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married with two kids. Her husband is a construction worker, and he supplies the family with required financials to satisfy the life needs. 

Seven years ago, Dalia started her own business, which is producing homemade food at her house. There is a big demand for her products, as she produces them in a very tasty way. 

Presently, Dalia wishes to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase raw materials so that she can augment her production. 

Dalia declares that she will be very thankful to the lenders who will help her receive the funds, especially that she is in a real need to obtain the loan to improve her business and gain higher income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003, le banc villageois vient d’entamer ses vingt troisième cycles dans le programme. L’activité principale des membres est le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. Les femmes en majorité ont une bonne maîtrise des caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il y a une bonne entente au sein du groupe.

Madame Fanta (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle  est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon et 02 filles. Elle gère en collaboration avec son mari une boutique de vente de pièces détachées. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Elle compte avec son nouveau prêt, acheter des pièces détachées automobiles pour une valeur de 500 000 Fr CFA.
 
En plus de renforcer son épargne, les bénéfices serviront à rendre meilleures les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on 22 January 2003, this "banc villageois" loan association has just begun its twentieth loan cycle. The members' main activity is small retail commerce supplemented by rain-fed agriculture.

Most of the women have a good command of credit and savings features. They all live in the same village and there are good relations within the group.

Mrs. Fanta (sitting on the right with her hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is the married mother of three children including one boy and 2 girls. She operates with her husband a shop selling spare parts. She has acquired good experience in this field having practiced it for years.

She will use the new loan to buy 500,000 CFA francs' worth of automotive spare parts.
 
In addition to bolstering their savings, the profits will be used to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy at least 47 50-kilo bags of unshelled groundnuts for processing and sales

loans.name: Dienabou Karimou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003, le banc villageois vient d’entamer ses vingt troisième cycles dans le programme. L’activité principale des membres est le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie. Les femmes en majorité ont une bonne maîtrise des caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et il y a une bonne entente au sein du groupe.

Madame Diénabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles âgés de 07 à 22 ans. Elle s’active dans la transformation de la pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète par sac de 50 kg de graine d’arachide pour la transformation et la revente au marché de sa commune. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter 13 sacs destinés à la transformation puis la vente par seau de 05 et 20 kg.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created 22 January 2003 and the banc villageois has just started its 23rd cycle in the program. The group members work primarily in small-scale commerce along with rain-fed agriculture. They mostly understand credit and how to save. They all live in the same village and get along well.

Diénabou (who is seated on the far right [of the photo] with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is the mother of seven children, of whom four are boys and three are girls, aged from seven to 22 years old.

Diénabou works making groundnut paste. She buys 50-kilogram sacs of groundnuts, makes them into paste, and then sells it at the market in her community. She does well with this work.

With this new loan, she wishes to buy 13 sacs [of groundnuts] which she will make into paste and then sell as five kilogram or 20 kilogram buckets.

With the earnings, she plans to actively take care of her family's needs and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 13 sacs of groundnuts

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Ines; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo aceite, arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea que su negocio crezca, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, hoteles, venta de ropa.
Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Señor de Puquin communal bank, located in the Cusco district belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
Ines is continuing with her business selling basic staples. She is grateful to those who will be part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established. She continues to sell oil, rice, sugar, and other products. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants her business to grow, as this is how she supports her family.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, milk, and other products.
The other members work in handcrafts, hotels, and clothing sales.
The members added to the photo requested permission to come late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Aramata's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Les sous  groupes qui le composent sont très dynamique dans le secteur du petit commerce et font preuves d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

Madame Aramata  (debout avec une main levée à l'extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  mariée et mère de 05 enfants (04 filles et 01 garçon). C’est une femme très engagée dans les activités du banc villageois. Elle est vendeuse de légumes frais, elle fait aussi de la glace et des jus à base de produits locaux. Elle s’approvisionne via les transporteurs en provenance  de la capitale au de la région sud. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans son domaine. 

Ce nouveau prêt  lui permettra de s’approvisionner toutes les deux semaines pour un montant de 125 000 Fr CFA en  carton de différentes variétés de légumes et des ingrédients pour les jus

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer son épargne d’une part et d’autre part participer de manière sensible aux changements de conditions de vie de sa famille.

NB : la femme en médaillon est venue en retard après la prise de vue du groupe.
texts.en:
Created December 13, 2003, the "banc villageois" loan association regroups women who share the ideal that each person should be useful to society and especially to his/her family. The subgroups are very dynamic in the area of small retail commerce and demonstrate solidarity and mutual assistance. Members all live in the same locality and are small retail merchants.

Mrs. Aramata (standing with one hand raised on the far right) is the group's featured borrower. She is the married mother of five children (four girls and one boy). She is a woman deeply involved in the activities of the "banc villageois".

She sells fresh produce, and also prepares ices and juice made from local products. She resupplies via transporters from the capital or the southern region, and has acquired extensive experience in her field.

This new loan will allow her to resupply every two weeks for a total of 125,000 CFA francs with cartons of different varieties of vegetables and ingredients for juices.

She plans to use the profits to improve her savings on the one hand, and on the other hand take a significant part in changing her family's living conditions.

NB: the woman in the picture inset was late for the group shooting.

loans.use: resupply every two weeks for a total of 125,000 CFA francs with cartons of different varieties of vegetables and ingredients for juices

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She is selling basic household commodities including cooking oil, powdered milk, biscuits, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and soap. She is a 54-year-old married woman with five dependents. One of her children is still attending school.


Leonor has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of  canned goods,  soft drinks, noodles, toiletries, and seasonings. This is essential to operating her store again. This will cause more consumers to shop and purchase items. In the long run, slowly she will start to fully recover and go back to her normal day to day activity.

 Leonor dreams to expand her business and make it productive. Hopefully this will bring progress to her livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned  goods, soft drinks, noodles, toiletries and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Ana Jean

texts.en:
Ana Jean is 39 years old, from Albuera, Leyte. She is married with three young children, ages three to thirteen. 

Ten years ago, Ana Jean started raising pigs for an income. However, it will take four months before she can sell her pigs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed, so she can feed them enough to be healthy and to fatten them. Healthy pigs are more attractive to buyers and will allow Ana Jean to negotiate better, when selling.

Ana Jean dream of always expanding her business, so she can support her children's needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Vanessa, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 7 y 4 años, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es controlador de un bus.
Doña Vanessa es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días por semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y se le hace más fácil salir a vender sus prendas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva tres años dedicada al comercio con  el cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and for its great crafts such as, for example, the straw hats known within and outside of the country.

In this place lives Vanessa. She is 26 year sold, married, and from this relationship, they have three children, ages 10, 7, and 4. The two older ones are students. Her husband is a bus driver.

Vanessa is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling all sorts of clothing. Her method of sales is door-to-door and she also sells from her house where her most known customers come. She works three days a week, but above all in the mornings, since at this time she takes advantage of her children being at school, and it is easier to go out to sell her clothing. She leaves the items on credit and collects every weekend. She has been working in the sales for three years, with which she earns her own money for the good of her family. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in this communal bank group for the past 4 years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children, from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their source of income.

Lilibeth is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, Lilibeth and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Lilibeth hopes to expand their fishing business and make it a success. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Fazlan

texts.en: Fazlan is a 59-year-old, married woman. She has had a business purchasing and selling animals, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. Fazlan is the mother of 7 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with a good education, and food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves in order to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers for generating greater revenue in the future

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel, de 21 años de edad, es comerciante en pequeños negocios, realizó sus estudios hasta 6° grado, es madre soltera debido a que su pareja lo abandonó.

Anabel, vive con su pequeña hija de dos años.- Anabel, trabaja juntamente con su madre y su hermano dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, ella fue tomando experiencia desde hace muchos años; también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos la cual realiza con su mamá.

Anabel, solicita el crédito para comprar un sistema de riego para el cultivo y sembrar maíz y regarlo en el verano.

El sueño de Anabel, es tener una buena cantidad de maíz para invierno y verano, ya que eso generará un ingreso mayor a su economía y de esa manera sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Anabel, 21, is a small businesswoman. She studied until sixth grade, and she is a single mother, having been abandoned by her partner. She lives with her little two-year-old daughter.

Anabel works alongside her mother and her brother, growing corn, and she has acquired many years’ experience.  She also sells cosmetics, along with her mother.


Anabel is requesting the loan in order to purchase an irrigation system for growing and planting corn, and for watering it in the summer. 

Anabel’s dream is to have a good quantity of corn for the winter and summer, as that will generate more income for her to support her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system for farming.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She works hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have done agricultural work for several years. They grow vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase several different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Khalida has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase several different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Mehra

texts.en: Mehra is a 48-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of 4 children. Mehra is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, so she started business purchasing and selling animals four years ago. She needs to improve her business in order to meet her households expenditures. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. Mehra wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es:
Evagelista, de 34 años de edad, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es empleado en una Empresa Alfaltica. 

Actualmente, tienen 3 hijos, los 2 hijos mayores ya son graduados de educación media y el menor aún está estudiando en educación básica.

Evgelista, se dedica a la elaboración de pan, trabajo que aprendió en una capacitación que llegaron a impartir en la comunidad donde ella reside.- Ella dice que está muy contenta, pues gracias a este oficio ha generar ingresos en su hogar que antes no tenia. 

Evangelista, elabora pan los días Miércoles y Viernes en compañía de una cuñada; todo con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades que día a día se presentan en el hogar.

Ella tomo la decisión de solicitar el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, canela, levadura y algunas bandejas que le hacían falta en su negocio.

Evangelista, además posee una pequeña tienda y sueña con ampliarla, la cual le generará más ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Evangelista, aged 34 years old, lives with her life partner who works at an asphalt company. They currently have three children, the two older kids have already graduated from high school, and the youngest is currently studying in grade school. Evangelista works making bread. She learned this trade during a training workshop offered in the community where she lives. She states that she is very happy because, thanks to this trade,  she has generated income for her home which she didn't have before. Evangelista bakes on Wednesdays and Fridays for her sister in law, to cover the daily needs of her home. She decided to ask for a loan to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon, yeast, and some baking sheets needed in her business. Evangelista also owns a small retail store. She dreams of expanding it, which will generate additional income for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cinnamon, yeast and some baking sheets needed in her business.

loans.name: Aasma

texts.en: Aasma is a 26-year-old, married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. Aasma buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises  them, and then sells them in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Aasma also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals, in order to increase her sales. She is very experienced, and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, Aasma will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, es un joven de 24 años de edad, residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, su negoció inició con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes están dedicados a la venta de ropa, artículos para el hogar y electrodoméstico, en su gran mayoría la compran fuera de la ciudad, él decidió seguir el ejemplo de sus padres y emprendió este negocio. Ofrece sus productos en las temporadas del año que más incrementa la demanda, sus principales clientes son sus amigos y vecinos a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago.  Su horario de atención es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. todos los días, él trabaja con mucho compromiso y dedicación, su meta de negocio es tener un almacén misceláneo y mejorar su flujo de caja.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa como jeans, camisas, pantalones para ofrecer en la temporada navideña. Esta inversión es muy oportuna para incrementar las ventas y con ello las utilidades.  Miguel es padre de una niña de un año de edad a quien desea ofrecerle una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel is a young 24-year-old man and resident of a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. His business began with the support of his parents who work selling clothes, home items, and electric appliances. They mostly buy them outside of the city. He decided to get a job with him and get started in this business. He offers his products in the times of the year that have higher demand; his main customers are friends and neighbors to whom he offers ease of payment. His schedule is from 8 to 6 every day; he works with a lot of commitment and dedication. His business goal is to have a miscellaneous store and to improve his cash flow. Right now he is applying to credikiva, first financing that he gets from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy clothes like jeans, shirts, and pants to sell during Christmas time. This investment is very timely to increase sales and ensure usefulness. Miguel is the father of a one-year-old daughter to whom he wants to give a good quality life.

loans.use: to buy clothes like jeans, shirts, and pants to offer at Christmas time.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi is 59 years old. He is married with four children, aged between 17 and 35 years, three of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 25 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, Yowasi would like to buy fertilizer for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maize.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a mother and she is married,she has six children of whom three attend school and the other three are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the support of Yehu, she wants to start a business of charcoal selling. She plans to sell in a retail shop, to the community. With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu, to receive financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Les  03 vont à l’école. Elle a  05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 60 complets pagnes.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Fatimata is married and has 3 children.  The eldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is 3 years old.  All 3 of her children currently attend school.  She is financially responsible for 5 people.

She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for eight years.  She buys her supplies from markets in her area.  Fatimata plans to use her loan to buy 60 pagnes.  She will save her profits to use them to expand her business.

In the future, Fatimata would like to be able to buy a plot of land and ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy 60 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing)

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees, for the family.

Kadzo operates a greengrocery (vegetable-selling) stall. She sells at the market, to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge -- in particular, the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding, and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es: Don Toribio nació en una comunidad llamada el sardinal en el año de 1967. Toda la vida don Toribio ha vivido en esta comunidad vivió con sus padres hasta la edad de 9 años ya que a esa edad murió el padre entonces él desde esa edad se creció con los abuelos paternos con los abuelos vivió hasta la edad de 23 años, durante este tiempo que vivió con sus abuelos el aprendió a trabajar en agricultura. A los 23 años conoció a doña Juana y se casó con ella y han procreado 3 hijos. El con esfuerzo y trabajando duro pudo comprar tierras en la que tiene sembrado café y cosecha con su hijos además el siembra granos básicos en su tierra. El comenta que en la vida hay que trabajar duro para tener sus cosas pero lo mejor es ganarse sus cosas con el sudor de su frente o como dicen trabajando duro.En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y el comenta que está bastante difícil y es por eso que el siempre ha querido comprar un panel pero no ha podido ya que los invierte en su casa que ya la tiene terminada. Don Toribio por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de un sistema solar y este será de gran beneficio ya que los hijos están estudiando y la luz servirá para que los hijos estudien por las noches o hagan sus tareas y la señora se levante por las mañanas a hacer la comida cuando salen a trabajar temprano el manifiesta que será de mucho provecho, y estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para comprar este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Don Toribio was born in a community called El Sardinal in the year 1967.  All his life, Toribio has lived in this community.  He lived with his parents until the age of 9.  At that age his father died, so from then on he grew up with his paternal grandparents.  He lived with them until the age of 23.  During the time that he lived with his grandparents he learned to work in farming.  At age 23 he met Juana and got married to her; they have three children.  

With effort and hard work he managed to buy some land where he has coffee planted.  He harvests it with his children, as well as planting basic staples on his land.  He says that in life it’s necessary to work hard in order to get things but the best way is to earn your things with the sweat of your brow, which is to say by working hard.  

There isn’t electricity in his community, and he says that this is pretty hard.  It is because of this that he has always wanted to buy a solar panel.  He hasn’t been able to because he has invested in his home, which he now has finished.  So Toribio is asking for a loan to buy a solar power system.  This will be a huge help, because his children are in school and the light will allow them to study at night and do their homework.  The lady of the house gets up in the morning to prepare food when they leave to work early, and he states that it will be a great advantage.  He would be very grateful if given the opportunity of this loan to buy a solar power system.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, fees and savings.  

She has operated a coconut-selling business for the past one year, selling to the community. She faces the major challenge of seasonality and competition. With the loan of 15,000, she wants to purchase a stock of coconut for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access the loan and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of coconut for resale

loans.name: Jose Jacobo

texts.es: José, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su padre, tres hijos, y su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. El inició trabajando en una hacienda como empleado y hace 15 años logró tener su propio ganado. Ahora cuenta con su propia generación de ingresos por venta de leche, la cual vende en su casa. Ha sostenido en buen estado los animales a través de la inversión de prestamos, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo en la institución que es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar vitaminas y desparasitantes para las vacas y para darle mantenimiento al pasto. Tiene como meta comprar mas vacas lecheras y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 48, married, has three children, and lives with his father, children, and wife in a hamlet of the Morazán municipality in Yoro. He started off working on a farm as an employee, and fifteen years ago he was able to have his own livestock.
He now generates his own income from selling milk form his home. He has kept the animals in good shape through loan investments. He is now requesting his fourth loan cycle with the institution. The loan is for 5,000 lempiras to buy vitamins and anti-parasite products for the cows and to maintain the pasture.
His goal is to buy more dairy cows and to provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and anti-parasite products for the cows and to maintain the pasture.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a married mother of five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sakina has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of transportation. Sakina dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay graduation costs for two of his children from university.

loans.name: Reshad

texts.en:
Reshad is a master. He is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. The family is living in the Baku region, but 20 years ago, they became IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home, which was Fuzuli city.

Reshad lives in the Baku region. He has been in the repair-construction business for two years and loves his job. This is his family's business. 

Reshad has applied for a loan in the amount of AZN 1,300 (Azerbaijan new manat) to buy new materials. 

Rehsad says, “Dear Kiva organization and dear lender, you helped me a lot.” 

In the future, he wants to increase his business and get married.

loans.use: to buy new materials for his repair-construction business.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Gracias al primer préstamo obtenido Don Francisco pudo comprar abono y todos los insumos para el cultivo de pipián lo cual le fue de mucho beneficio porque logro una buena producción. Esta vez solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono e insumos para su nueva siembra de chiltomas, estima que gracias a este financiamiento lograra buena cosecha y lograra vender todo el producto obteniendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Thanks to his first loan, Mr. Francisco was able to buy fertilizer and all the supplies needed to plant squash, which was very beneficial given that he obtained a good crop. This time he is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizer and supplies for his new green pepper crop. He believes that, thanks to this loan, he will get a good harvest and will be able to sell all of the product obtaining good earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and supplies for his new green pepper crops

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es: Don Ramón como muchos Nicaragüenses ha venido mejorando las condiciones de su hogar por etapas, ya que su salario como guarda de seguridad es muy poco, tiene bajo su cargo a dos hijos quienes estudian. Don Ramón solicita este crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su hogar, en esta ocasión desea continuar la construcción de cuartos que empezó lo cual no ha podido terminar por falta de materiales y dinero, ahora con el préstamo comprara bloque, cemento, hierro, arena para continuar la obra que vendrá a garantizar un mejor espacio para la comodidad de sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en: Ramón, like many Nicaraguans, has been improving his home in stages. His salary as a security guard is very low. He has two children to care for. They are both in school. Ramon is requesting this loan to continue investing in his home. He would like to continue building the rooms that he started; he has not been able to finish because of lack of money and materials. Now, with this loan, he will buy blocks, cement, iron, and sand to continue with the work. He will secure a better space for the comfort of his children and wife.

loans.use: to keep building a room for his children.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association DIANTOYERELA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de beurres de karité à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de beurres de karité.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de beurres de karité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de beurres karité.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et environ auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badenya Group is part of the Diantoyerela partnership in N'Tentou, gathering women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties. On average, the group members are 37 years old, married and have an average of five children each. They run various businesses, such as the purchase and sale of shea butters, like Mariam, who is the first person standing in the photo, left to right. These women live in large traditional families in N'Tentou in the Kati Prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been running small businesses for several years and are very sought after in their businesses of the purchase and sale of shea butters. With the goal of meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. They are on their ninth group loan.

Mariam is the group's leader and is well known in N'Tentou, [where she] excels in the sale of shea butters. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of shea butters. She gets her supplies in Ouelessebougou and from wholesalers, and sells her products in Ouelessebougou at retail prices for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers.

Mariam is hoping for a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, a sum that will allow her to repay the loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase shea butters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a steer.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a wonderful woman. She is married. She is the main breadwinner in her family as her husband’s income is small. It is very difficult for her to provide her 3 children with all of the things they need.

She has been busy with animal husbandry and growing vegetables for more than 15 years. She works in this business with pleasure, since she likes animals. As she was born and grew up in a village, she has a great deal of experience in this field.

Shoira buys animals in the local market and fattens them in her barn. After some months she resells the animals in the local market. Her children help her with the business. She wants to increase the number of cattle she has in working capital. Currently she is asking for a loan of 8,500 TJS (somoni) to buy cattle.

This is Shoira's 5th loan from IMON. She used previous loan for her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories for his new store.

loans.name: Noomali

texts.en:
Noomali is 33 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with five children. She does livestock trading in Narok town and has been in this business for ten years. She will be using this loan to buy more goats to sell, and will use the anticipated profits to buy cattle to sell.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to be successful and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Sindy Paola

texts.es: Sindy es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad,  dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir entre ellas, sandalias, suéteres, blusas, jeans.  Su idea de negocio inicio a través de un amigo que la ánimo para que vendiera sandalias, pero tal fue su éxito que decidió también ofrecer prendas de vestir.  Ella reside en un barrio situado al suroccidente de Barranquilla, donde también habitan la gran mayoría de sus clientes; vecinos y amigos, a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago en sus compras. Sindy realiza sus compras de contado a distribuidores, pero su capital le es insuficiente para cubrir con toda la demanda, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de sandalias, jeans, suéteres y blusas para comercializar en la temporada decembrina, considerando que es una época en la que sus clientes tienen mas capacidad de pago. Sus metas para su negocio son incrementar el surtido y con ello incrementar las ventas, así mismo hacer crecer su negocio y a nivel personal es culminar con sus estudios de enfermería.
texts.en:
Sindy is a young, enterprising, 22-year-old woman. She makes a living selling articles of clothing such as sandals, sweaters, blouses, and jeans. Her business idea came about from a friend who encouraged her to sell sandals, but she had such success that she decided to also offer articles of clothing. She resides in a neighborhood in southwest  Barranquilla, which is also where the majority of her customers live; neighbors and friends, to whom she offers easy payment for their purchases.

Sindy makes cash purchases from the distributors, but her capital is insufficient to cover all of the demand, now because of this she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she is making to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; capital she will use to buy sandals, jeans, sweaters, and blouses in order to sell during December, considering that this is the time that her customers have the most ability to pay. Her goals for her business are to increase her selection, increase her sales and thus make her business grow, and at a personal level to finish her nursing studies.

loans.use: to buy sandals, jeans, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1970, and she lives in a rural area. She is married and has four children. Sanobar has worked for about 10 years selling textile materials. As a retailer, she sells up-to-date textile materials for her customers. She considers the demand for her products in the market and buys useful goods. The standard of living in winter is aggressive. It is cold in winter. She is planning to improve conditions in her house and is asking for financial support for heating her house. She needs to buy heating materials for a heater.

loans.use: to buy heating materials for her home.

loans.name: Nathanaël Group

texts.fr: Jaenette est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Nathanaël, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des laits caillés et yaourt au marché du port public depuis 14 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 50 kilos de lait caillé et 100litres de yaourt. Son conjoint est un commerçant aussi. Elle souhaite acheter une chambre froide, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Jaenette is a businesswoman and president of the Nathanaël community bank. A customer of IMF Hekima, she is 34 years old, married and mother to four children, all of whom go to school. She has been selling curds and yogurt at the market in the public port for the past 14 years. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to buy 50 kilos of curds and 100 liters of yogurt. Her husband is also a businessman. She would like to buy a cold room, and also be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos  of curds and 100 liters of yogurt.

loans.name: Segundo Guilo

texts.es:
Segundo , de 43 años de edad de estado civil felizmente casado, desde hace más de 20 años, Segundo nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia Alaquez un barrio muy humilde, pero lleno de oportunidades, vive en casa propia , desde ahí se dedicó a trabajar en una mecánica como maestro ayudante, y ahora ya tiene su propio taller ese fue el inicio para aprender lo que más le gustaba siguió algunos cursos para poder obtener como profesión mecánico, esta profesión es la que le ayudado a salir adelante durante mucho tiempo, para poder sustentar su hogar,  y hoy su esposa se llena de orgullo al tener a su lado a Segundo una persona luchadora y muy responsable que trabaja muy duro todos los días para poder dar a María y a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten, María y Segundo tiene 2 bellos hijos los cuales juegan por toda la casa llenado a sus padres de alegría.
Segundo se dedica a la enderezada y pintura de autos y su esposa se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, desde su hogar, este sector es muy reconocido por esta actividad económica, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres quienes desde pequeño le enseñaron, trabaja de 6 a 7 horas diarias con el apoyo de su esposa, lo más difícil de esta actividad considera es el esfuerzo que esto conlleva.
Segundo  tiene un gran sueño y este es el ver a sus hijos crecer sanamente y que lleguen a ser unos grandes profesionales.
En estos momentos Segundo necesita comprar ganado para el negocio de su esposa, es por eso que hoy se acerca a Fundacion para solicitar un crédito para que sus ventas sigan aumentando como en estos últimos meses, es por esta razón que Segundo ha manifestado su necesidad y a la vez da el agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Segundo, who is 43-years old, has been happily married for more than twenty years.  Segundo was born in Latacunga, Alaquez Parrish, a very humble neighborhood that is full of opportunities.  He lives in his own home.  Segundo worked in a auto repair shop as a master mechanic's assistant, and now he has his own workshop.  That was how he got started learning the trade that he likes so much.  He then took some courses to become a professional mechanic.  His profession has been helping him to get ahead for a long time and to be able to support his household.  Segundo's wife is proud to have him, a hard-working and very responsible person who works every day to give María and their children everything they need, by her side.  María and Segundo have two beautiful children who fill their parents with joy as they play around the house. 
Segundo makes his living in auto-body work and painting.  His wife earns her living in agriculture and raising animals in their home.  The area they live in is well-known for these businesses.  María learned the trade from her parents at a very young age.  She works six or seven hours a day with her husband's help.  The most difficult part of her business is the physical effort it requires. 
Segundo's greatest hope is to see his children grow with health and to have good careers. 
Segundo needs to purchase livestock for his wife's business, which is why he came to Fundación Alternativa to request a loan.  The loan will help their sales to increase, as they have in the last months.  That is why Segundo has made his need known to us at Fundación Alternativa.  He thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for it making it possible for him to grow personally and with his family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to support the business of his wife, and they will grow together professionally.

loans.name: Orley Orlando

texts.es:
Orley un señor de 35 años, tiene tres hijos que pasan con él ya que su conyugue vive en Manabí separada. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre en la ciudad  de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, es la ciudad enlace entre la sierra y la costa, por ello existe bastante intercambio comercial. También en esta zona habita la etnia Tsachila o llamados Colorados, por eso el nombre del cantón. 
Desde hace 10 años tiene experiencia en cerrajería, Orley elabora puertas, portones y ventanas, trabaja todos los días en su pequeño taller, por su buen trabajo es reconocido en el sector y tiene bastante clientela.
Orley con este crédito ampliará su local y también va a poner una puerta más grande al taller ya que actualmente solo le alcanza para poner sus herramientas de trabajo
Agradece enormemente a la institución porque gracias a los microcréditos los clientes pueden superarse como él lo ha logrado.
texts.en:
Orley is a 35-year-old man who has three children who spend time with him, since his partner lives separately in Manabí. They live in his mother's house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, which is the city that connects the mountains and the coast, where there is quite a bit of trade. Also in this region, lives the Tsachila ethnic group, called "Colorados" ("colored red"), for which the area was named.

Orley has ten years of experience in the locksmith trade, making doors, gates and windows. He works every day in his tiny shop and he is recognized in the area for his hard work and for having many customers.

With this loan, Orley will expand his shop as well as put in a larger door, since currently he can only manage to put his work tools there.

He is very grateful for the institution because, thanks to the microloans, the clients can better themselves like he has managed to do.

loans.use: to expand his shop and to put in a larger door. He will support his children with the income.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 19 años de edad, el es una joven emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene 2 hijos que mantener el primero tiene dos años de edad y el segundo tiene 3 meses de nacido.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 4 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para la compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 19 years old, he is an entrepreneurial young man, and he decided that in order to succeed in life, he can't let himself be defeated by the obstacles that life gives him, but instead reach for all his goals and dreams. He has two children, the first is 2 years old and the second is 3 months old. 

He makes his living through producing bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him how to do this activity from since he was four years old. He sells his products in the market and elsewhere around his community and thus earns income with which to improve the living conditions of his family.

The respective use that he has for this loan is to buy fertilizer and pay laborers for the maintenance of bananas, since for him it's of the utmost importance that his bananas plants produce fruits of the highest quality so he doesn't lose the clients he relies on.

One of Francisco's biggest aspirations is to sow more banana plants and to see the growth of his children in school and to become a professional in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers to maintain his bananas

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 42-year-old married woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is a merchant who runs a small sari-sari, which is a variety store that sells goods and food items to the people in her neighborhood. Rosie has been in the business for more than eight years now.

Rosie is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, soap, toiletries, eggs, condiments, rice, bread, and biscuits. A loan will help her to improve her store's inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income. Rosie hopes to make her business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, soap, toiletries, eggs, condiments, rice, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda owns and operates a vulcanizing shop. She caters services for truck and motorcycle repairs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 20 years. She comes from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a mother of three children, the youngest of whom is 17 years old.

Due to scarcity of capital, Morena has requested a loan to buy vulcanize kit tools and spare parts. These tools are essential for her shop, making her respective customers satisfied with her services. She builds good relationships with customers by providing quality and affordable services. In this way, she could earn a higher income.

Imelda is hoping that someday she will successfully manage her business to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy vulcanize kit tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1984, and she lives in rural area. She is married and has one child. Her husband works as construction worker. She is a sewer, and her mother helps her with the business. Her mother taught her how to sew. Madina sews traditional dresses for women. She considers a modern condition where every woman wants to have a stylish dress. 

In the winter, their house is cold. She does not want to have a sick child. She is planning to heat her house for winter and has to buy heating materials for warming her house. Madina is asking for financial support for buying materials for heating a house.

loans.use: to buy heating materials for warming her house.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman and the mother of three children who attend school. Her husband works repairing cars, and they work together to pay for big family expenses. She has been producing homemade food at her home for the past year. She sells the items at good prices to multiple customers. Today, Nadia is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as containers, pots, and jars. In the future, Nadia looks forward to expanding her business and enlarging it by borrowing more Kiva loans, increasing her production, and targeting a wider clientele.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies such as containers, pots, and jars

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has a tailoring business in Kitengela town that she has been running for four years. She designs and makes different kinds of clothes to sell, ranging from shirts, blouses, coats and trousers. She is 42 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of textile garments, threads, and buttons for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.

This will be her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, as she successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and also improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married. She has a 16-year-old daughter. Natalya has her own business. She has been selling women's clothing for 10 years. She rents a place at the market. Natalya is a hardworking and open person. In the future she is planning to get her own retail place.  

Natalya is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's clothes for the winter season. This loan will help her to get new clients.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of women's clothes for the winter season and attract new clients

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: Jamshed is a goal oriented person. He was born in 1995. He is single. He lives with his family. He studies at university. He is a second year student. Jamshed has a dream to become a doctor. He wants his dream to become a reality. He is studying well. He tries to be the best student in his class. Jamshed is well known among friends for his kindness. He has to pay university tuition fees and he needs financial support to do so.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 35 years old and from Albuera, Leyte. She is married and has one daughter who is thirteen years old. Cristina is engaged in two businesses to earn a living: raising hogs and selling food. She usually cooks pancakes, bread, and pork barbecue. She started her business two years ago. This usually earns her 6,000 PHP per month. 

Cristina is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed, piglets, condensed milk, evaporated milk, flour, cooking oil, yeast, baking powder, sugar, catsup, skewers, and gelatin. It is her hope that through her hog raising and and food vending businesses, she will be able improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, condensed milk, evaporated milk, flour, cooking oil, yeast, baking powder, sugar, catsup, skewers, and gelatin

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Litzi es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Panamericana’ donde se ubica gran parte de la actividad económica del comercio en general y la industria manufacturera. Se encuentra en la zona de los valles, a una altura aproximada de 2500 metros sobre el nivel del mar y tiene una temperatura templada todo el año.
Litzi es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lacio amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su hija que todavía no está en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres que es propia y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Gracias al impulso que recibe de su hija por mejorar sus ingresos y establecerse en su negocio formó una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina y servicio técnico de equipos, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos; productos para la higiene corporal o para mejorar la apariencia, especialmente del rostro, su comercio es de forma ambulante, ella se encarga de visitar (cargada de una maleta y varios catálogos) las comunidades y provincias cercanas para ofrecer sus productos a tiendas, oficinas, etc. de marcas como; Mac, Chanel, Burberry, Dolce&Gabbana, Dior y otros y productos como; mascaras, bases, corrector, brillos, lápices, sombras, tonos, 1/2 tonos, plumones, permanentes, labiales rojos, etc. “para vender cosméticos se debe caminar bastante, lo bueno es que las clientas son constantes y siempre terminan llevándose algo, la caminata no es en vano…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda grande de venta de cosméticos. Ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de productos de belleza por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada. Esta es su 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Litzi solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para bastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Litzi is a single 24-year-old woman with a three-year-old daughter. She sells cosmetics.
She is sweet, caring, sensible, sincere, a good mother, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the Panamericana zone where there is a great deal of general commercial activity and manufacturing. This is in Los Valles, at an altitude of approximately 2500 metres above sea level. The region has a temperate climate year round.
Litzi is dark-skinned with long, straight black hair tied back. She is short. Her mother tongue is Quechua, and she speaks it with her family. For business, she speaks Spanish. She lives her life with her daughter, who is not school-aged yet. She lives in her parents' home, which they own. The home has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing. Her daughter motivates her to improve her income and stabilize her business. Because of this, she formed a bank of people with businesses such as: weaving; fish sales; construction services; empanada sales; cosmetics sales; seasonal clothing sales; machine weaving; and electronic services. They put together the group to request a loan and improve their businesses.
Litzi sells cosmetics: products to improve hygiene or appearance, especially the face. She sells door to door. With a briefcase and several catalogues, she visits the communities and provinces nearby to offer her products to stores, offices, etc. She sells brands such as Mac, Chanel, Burberry, Dolce&Gabbana, Dior and others. She sells products such as mascara, foundation, concealer, glitter, pencils, shades, toners and half toners, liners, lipstick, dyes, etc. 
"In order to sell cosmetics, one has to walk a lot. The good thing is that the clients are loyal and they always take something; the walk is not in vain" she says. Her dream is to have a large cosmetics store. She wants to invest in her business with the wholesale purchase of beauty products in order to cover the demand of her seasonal clients. This is her third loan with the institution in the four years she has had this business.
For these reasons, Litzi is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of cosmetics in order to supply her seasonal customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 30-year-old married Syrian father of three children who works as an electrician. He has done this for eighteen years to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Nader is an ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers for his hard work and honesty. He is also trying desperately to satisfy his family's needs, thus acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to cover the expenses of his father's surgery.

Nader hopes his father gets well soon. He also hopes to develop his business to stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of his father's surgery.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 43 years old. He is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 21. All of his children go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 19 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more maize fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more maize fertilizer

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo engages in a fish-vending business. He sells fresh fish to the people in his community using his motorcycle. In addition to that, he also engages in selling balot (a developing duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell). It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines. He has a 15-year-old dependent.

Eduardo is asking for a loan to buy additional fresh fish and balot. These will help Eduardo and his family purchase more fresh fish and balot to resell. Slowly, he could earn bigger earnings, and thus continue providing for the needs of his family.

He is hoping that he can make both of his businesses successful, and hopefully this is the way he is going to achieve a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish and balot to sell.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is an Egyptian Albanian lady who lives in the city of Korca, where the majority of her ethnic community has been living for some generations. She is 48 years old and married. She works in some homes in her city as a helper and receives payment for the services she offers. She is also a mother of two talented sons who still live with her, one who plays kitar and the other who sells industrial items. Kindly note that Egyptian Albanians have proved to have many talents, including music, hands-on trades, and buying/selling items.

Albina is requesting your financial help for home repairs. Winter has already started and the first signs of a damaged home have already been showing recently.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a grocery business in Machakos and has been running this business for 15 years. She is 49 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, oranges and bananas for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. They live in Agsu. She has a good family. She is a housekeeper and has a good pomegranate garden. She grows the trees in her garden and her husband helps her too. Sevda has good experience in the agriculture sector. She earns 120 manat in this business. It is not enough money to provide for the family. She sells only pomegranates in the bazaar.

She wants to increase her business and to buy new trees and fertilizer. For this reason, she requested 1,500 AZN from Kiva. It is her first loan. Sevda hopes the lenders support her.

loans.use: to buy new trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Pirayu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Pirayu Poty está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, todas y cada una de ellas esta haciendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ser mejor cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo constante ella a logrado el crecimiento de su negocio y su familia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, y comenta que todos los días tiene ya muchos pedidos, y por medio de ellos ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Nancy solicita este préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de Tortas, como ser confites en general y helados,  todo esto le ayudará al crecimiento de su negocio y por lo tanto a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Pirayu Poty and is in its fifth loan cycle in the women's group. Each and every member is doing her best to grow and be better every day.
One of the members is Nancy. Through hard and constant work she is expanding her business and raising her family. She makes cakes, and says that every day she has many orders. Through this, she helps her family.
Nancy is requesting this loan for the purchase of ingredients to make cakes, candy, and ice cream. This will help her to grow economically and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy candy, ice ceram, and cake ingredients.

loans.name: Puertas Abiertas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Puertas abiertas está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, con poca seguridad, y acceso a medios de comunicación.
La Sra. Blanca es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de despensa, ella por medio de su negocio ayuda a su familia y les da para poder cubrir el día a día de las necesidades de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para que por medio de él pueda comprar insumos daros para poder surtir su negocio, con verduras, carne, lácteos, y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Puertas Abiertas ["Open Doors"] group is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee. The group members are from the city of Curuguaty, in a zone that is still developing and not very safe. The area has poor access to communications technology.
Blanca is one of the group members. She has a small store through which she helps her family and provides what is necessary day to day to cover the needs of her loved ones.
She is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies to stock her business. She will purchase vegetables, meat, dairy products, and more.
She is grateful for this opportunity. It will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, dairy products, and more to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas por un progreso digno y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas, en ese ciclo del préstamo solo 16 mujeres retiran esta préstamo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta,  ella demuestra siempre una actitud positiva dedicándose a su labor de todos los días en la compra de productos varios para surtir su pequeña despensa que se encuentra situada en su propia casa que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar y que hoy día ya se encuentra bien asentada.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos o artículos de primera necesidad, como ser comestibles, verduras, lácteos, panificados y demás, para la venta que lo hace de forma permanente y también por pedidos, lo que le ayudará  a mejorar su nivel de pobreza generando mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of 17 women inspired by dignified progress and improvement of the quality of life of each one of them. During this cycle, only 16 women are taking out the loan.

One of the members is Vicenta. She always demonstrates a positive attitude, doing her daily work of buying a variety of products to stock her small grocery store located in her own home. With a great deal of effort she was able to open it and today it is well-established.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy staple products or articles such as groceries, vegetables, milk products, bread products, and others in order to sell, which she does on a continuous basis and also via orders. This will help her to improve her level of poverty, generating more income.

loans.use: to buy staple items such as groceries, vegetables, milk products, bread products, and others

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bertha continua con su negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua preparando tortas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan para los distintos compromisos que se realizan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azucar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Siempre Unidos group. The bank is located in the province and department of Cusco. Bertha is continuing with her business making cakes. 
She is grateful for this loan and promises to repay it as established. She is a responsible person. She continues to make cakes and other items for her clients, who request her products for their various engagements. This is how she provides for her family.
Bertha is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies such as flour and sugar.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mqbel

texts.en:
Mqbel is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis with two sons. Two years ago, Mqbel opened a store for selling shoes. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve his business and expand the store in the future.

Mqbel requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women and kids shoes for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Mqbel will be able to increase his sales and income. Mqbel appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes.

loans.name: Faredah

texts.en:
Faredah is a 49-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She is the mother of one son and four daughters. Her husband works as a farmer, earning a low and unstable income. Faredah has a barn where she has been raising sheep for the past fifteen years. It is a very good business and provides the family with a good income. Her kids also help her with her agricultural work.

Faredah has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. By taking this loan, she hopes to increase her barn's productivity as well as the family income.

Faredah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a 33-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) and sells various goods and items to the people in her community. Alona has been in the business for more than four years now.

Alona is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, and condiments. This loan will enable Alona to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Alona dreams of expanding her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Venant

texts.en:
Venant is 46 years old. He is married with one child, not yet go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions.

(The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.)

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize to sell.

loans.name: Stephane

texts.en:
Stephane is 56 years old and married with two children, ages ten and fifteen years old. Both children attend school. Stephane is a farmer who has been farming for 20 years.
