With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers of maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.en:
Aldo is a 35-year-old who is married to Elsa, seen in the photograph. They are the parents of two children, ages eight and five years old. Aldo is requesting this loan to pay for his wife’s master's degree fees. 

Elsa has been working toward completing her master's degree; this is the last year of her program. While Aldo has been working in the military for some years, his wife has been working as a high-school teacher in a village school. In addition to these incomes, they also have a dairy cow from which they produce and sell raw milk and a baby calf each year. Because they have their paid jobs, they say they have no available time to focus on agricultural activity, even though they live in a village.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his wife's master's degree

loans.name: Chonalyn

texts.en:
Chonalyn is a resident of the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 30-year-old woman with a six-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter. Chonalyn earns a living by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household merchandise like eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and soap. To augment her income, she also raises hogs.

Chonalyn has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries for her store and pig feed. These supplies are essential to operating her store and to raising and selling healthy hogs.

Chonalyn hopes to be successful in managing her business for the welfare of her growing child.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for her store and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Ikromjon is a clever, goal-oriented boy who is from a poor family. He is single and was born in 1991. Ikromjon lives in a rural area with family and helps his parents at home. His parents are proud of him.

He is a university student. Despite his standard of living, he believes positively. He is prepared in classes everyday. He tries to be educated and is well known among classmates. He is helpful and communicative with friends.

Ikromjon has to pay university tuition, but his parents do not have enough money. He is asking for financial support to pay the university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fishing nets, lead weights, crab nets, hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a maize farmer. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Naomi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Naomi  is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for her children. She also hopes to ensure that they gain access to a high quality education.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro: Es una mujer originaria de Waspam Río Coco; es emprendedora; tiene 49 años de edad, madre soltera, con tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Es comerciante, desde hace 15 años estableció una pequeña comideria y venta de refrescos, en un anexo de madera que construyó en su vivienda. Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio aporta económicamente en el hogar. Está solicitando por primera vez un préstamo para comprar en Managua mesas y sillas plásticas para acondicionar su comedor y vitrinas para exhibir los productos de reposterías que  elabora e insumos para ampliar el menú que ofrece; esto le permitirá incrementar sus ventas a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam y de esa manera también incrementar sus ingresos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
Mercede del Socorro is a woman originally from Waspam Rio Coco. She is an entrepreneur who is 49 year old. She is a single mother with three independent adult children.

She has been a businesswoman since she established a small cafe and soft drinks stand 15 years ago in a wooden annex built onto her home. She supports the household with the earnings she generates from her business.

She is asking for a loan for the first time to buy in Managua plastic tables and chairs to upgrade her dining area and showcases to exhibit the pastry products she makes and supplies in order to expand the menu she offers. This will allow her to expand her sales at favorable prices to her customers in Waspam and she will also be able to increase her income. 

She dreams of having a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy in Managua plastic tables and chairs to upgrade her dining area and showcases

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат 35 лет, в разводе, есть 3 детей. По характеру она очень спокойная и позитивная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством. Начав со стартовой суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS) в 2006 году, сегодня в хозяйстве Рахат имеется 3 коровы, 2 лошади, 30 овец. Бизнес приносит 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, также она работает архивариусом и получает заработную плату около 10,400 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Рахат и ее детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Rahat is a 35 year old divorced woman with three children. She has a calm and optimistic personality. To support her family, she raises livestock. Rahat started in 2006 with 4,000 KGS and now has three cows, two horses, and 30 sheep. She makes 3,000 monthly from her livestock business, and also works  as an archivist, making around 10,400 KGS. This income is really inadequate to support Rahat and her children. 

To grow her business, Rahat took a loan from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, for 125,000 KGS to buy cows and sheep to increase her herd. She plans to use the income from this loan to further develop her business and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep to grow her family's income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his next semester's university fees

loans.name: Razan

texts.en: Razan is a 20-year-old single lady. She lives with her three siblings in Baqaa, one of the Palestinian refugee camps in Jordan. Razan is in her third year at the university, majoring in economics. She is applying for a loan to help her pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's school fees.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Saima has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants  to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Shahrifan

texts.en: Shahrifan is a 55-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.en:
Mathieu is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 5 years, one of whom goes to school. He has been farming for 20 years. With the requested loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for producing maize

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 43, a married woman and the mother of five children. She deals in the business of selling milk with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron has a hotel business in Thika town and has been running this business for 15 years now. He is 44 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with six children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, vegetables, beans, maize, meat and cooking oil for use in his business. This will enable him to serve more customers and make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid back his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, vegetables and cooking oil for use in his business.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar, a-31-year-old single woman from Tubas, a village near Nablus, lives with her parents in a humble house. Four years ago, she started her own business, a sewing workshop that she conducts from a small room in the family house. Samar sews for local traders who order specific clothing pieces.

Samar requested a USD loan from FATEN to help her buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. This will enable her to turn out higher quality items faster.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for the new season by tilling the soil, adding fertilizers and planting seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, she has been running a retail cloth business. She buys various fabrics, in different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough income through her business. Nasreen has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nasreen expects a boost in her earnings with the help of the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Zakkia

texts.en:
Zakkia  is a 49-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. 

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

Zakkia has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is standing next to many bobo (fish cages used to trap fish). She is a 53-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has depended on her fishing business for fifteen years now, helping her husband who is a fisherman. Recently, Evelyn also learned about direct-selling businesses, mostly products from Avon. She is asking a loan to buy fishing nets and Avon products like lotion, perfume, and body talc to sell to her customers.

Evelyn is hoping to save in order to prepare for her future needs when she is older. In the future, she plans to continue expanding her business to make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and Avon products like lotion, perfume, and body talc

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She has a grocery business in Kitengela town and has been running this business for five years. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She successfully repaid her previous loan. In future she hopes to improve her business and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra, a 42-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing clothes that she sells to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Zohra has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth, spools of thread, and buttons in various colors to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Zohra’s eighth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth, spools of thread, and buttons

loans.name: Adibasi Mahila Shg Group

texts.en:
Ukia is the featured borrower of the Adibasi Mahila Self-help group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Peoples Forum, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard to develop their businesses and lives.

Ukia is a 49-year-old mother of two children who has been running her own general store since March 2012. She has five years of experience in this domain, since she used to work in the same domain in a big general store in Sonepur market before she started this business. Ukia is working hard to make sure that she can support her children and raise them properly, taking the role of both the caring mother and the hardworking father at the same time, as her husband lives in another city for his job.

Today, her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with cold drinks, cosmetic products and a fridge, since currently she can't afford doing so because of the increased living needs of her children.

As for the other group members, they are engaged in different activities.

loans.use: to buy cold drinks, cosmetic products and a fridge to increase the sales.

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en:
Shahmeem has successfully built her business, selling milk, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now, she has attained a good number of customers and she makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family's income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, Shahmeem was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities, to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales to more cities, to gain more profits.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is a strong woman. She was born in 1989 and lives in a rural area. She grew up in bad conditions. Her family was poor. She is single. 

She went to school when she was seven. Since childhood, she feels responsibility for her parents. She graduated excellent from her school. 

After graduation, she worked, at the school, as a librarian. Her wage was not enough for keeping and helping her family. 

She decided to learn how to sew in order to earn some additional income. She is planning to get a sewing machine and all the stuff needed for sewing. Khursheda is needing financial support for buying tools and learning how to sew. 

She hopes to get more revenue from her new business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and learn how to sew.

loans.name: Kuña Kuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kuera Katupyry  es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza implementado por la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delfina ella  es cliente de la Fundación hace varios años, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como ser empanadas , chipas , sopa paraguaya, con lo cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere seguir creciendo para dar a su familia todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser carnes, pollo, verduras, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
Kuña Kuera Katupyry is a group that formed in the city of Encarnación. They are in their 12th cycle in the Committee of Women Program in its Poverty Elimination Program implemented by Fundación Paraguaya. 

One of the members is Delfina. She’s been a client of Fundación Paraguaya for several years. She sells food such as empanadas, cheese-filled buns, and corn bread through which she has the means to help her family and her loved ones.

She is a very hardworking person who wants to keep advancing in order to give her family everything that she could not have. She has requested this loan to buy supplies for her food preparation including meat, poultry, vegetables, seasonings, and more.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make empanadas and corn bread

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 67 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She does farming in Thika town where she grows maize, beans and vegetables to sell and she has been in the farming business for the past 14 years.

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her grandchildren.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on her farm.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma  is a 35-year-old married woman with a hand embroidery business that makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that enables her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her continue operations, Salma has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy spools of threads in various colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stone embellishments; these purchases will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

Salma hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in various colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stone  embellishments.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia  is a 38-year-old, married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Shazia ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shazia  has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, along with some tools and spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, along with some tools and spare parts for husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Liberacion Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ que  es una pequeña área ubicada al este de la ciudad, es conocido por sus comidas típicas y su artesanía, especialmente de cerámicas. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. los deseos de ofrecerles una mejora calidad de vida a sus hijos la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de materiales de construcción, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y  venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui),  Majadito (de charque, de pollo y de pato, además de plátano  y huevo frito), Locro Carretero (incluye arroz, charque y plátano, papa, cebolla verde y huevo), Pipián de Pollo (lleva presas de pollo con salsa de maní y arroz blanco), Rapi al jugo (carne de res cocida y acompañada con arroz y yuca). Negocio que realiza todos los días de la semana a horas de almuerzo y los fines de semana también por las noches. “la comida es un negocio rentable porque todos los días se come…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante en el mercado y mejorar su atención al cliente. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes
texts.en:
Virginia is a 24 year old woman who is single and has three children of ages 6, 4, and 2 years old. Her business is in the sale of traditional food. She is generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, caring, strong, a good mother, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is done in the neighborhood of 'Cotaca', which is a small area located east of the city, known for its food and crafts, especially ceramics. The climate is warm, tropical, and humid all year with temperatures that vary during the day between 23 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Virginia is dark skinned with long black hair tied back, has dark eyes, and a strong physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks spanish for general culture and for use in her work. She wanted to offer a better quality of life for her children, leading her to start a bank of people with commercial activities such as the sale of construction materials, sale of french fries, sale of sportswear, sale of sandwiches, a neighborhood store keeper, and a butcher. They are asking for a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is the sale of traditional food like cogote relleno (creole chicken neck, filled with potatoes or liver), majadito (jerky, chicken and duck, with banana and fried egg), loco carretero (includes rice, jerky, bananas, potatoes, green onion, and egg), pipián de pollo (chicken pieces with peanut sauce and white rice), and rap al jugo (cooked beef with rice and yucca)

She does business all the days of the week at lunch hours and also on weekends at night. "Food is a profitable business because everyday you eat...", she says. Her dream is to have a restaurant in the market and improve customer service. She wants to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs to serve a larger quantity of customers. This is her first loan with the institution.  She has been doing this activity for one year. It is for these reasons above that Virginia asks for a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs to serve a higher number of customers.

loans.use: to puchase tables and chairs in order to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 35-year-old, married woman who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sajida makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Sajida wishes to use part of her revenues to provide a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a motorcycle transport business in Thika town and has been in the business for ten years now. He is 41 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat  is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. She has been doing the business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. 

She accepted the fact that, if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household, with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. 

Together with her husband, Zeenat manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now, Zeenat has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase a new sewing machine, along with thread, buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on-time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Zeenat hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, along with thread, buttons, ribbons, and laces.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old, single and has 1 child. He has a shoe repair business and also a bakery business in Narok.  He has been in this business for 3 years. 

He will be using this loan to purchase more stock of baking flour and cooking fat for use in his bakery. This will enable him to supply more bread and scones to his retail shop customers. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more stock of baking flour. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of baking flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is called Maa Annapurna Self-Help Group. It consists of eleven women from a small village in Boudh district of Odisha, India. They applied for a loan of 165,000 INR from Peoples Forum.

Surekha is 46 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of two children. She lives with them in a miserable condition, in the village where this group exists. Surekha's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and his income is very limited. He does not bring home enough to cover the needs of the family. The house where Surekha and her family live lacks a lot of home appliances, and most of them are very old. Surekha wants to improve the living condition of the family.

Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she, along with her group, applied for this loan, from which she will use her portion in order to purchase grocery items in bulk to start a small grocery shop. She will buy edible oil, spices, biscuits, flour, rice, and other grocery items.

Surekha looks forward to providing her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, spices, biscuits, flour, rice, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
This borrower group is called Maa Annapurna (A) Self-help Group. It consists of ten women from a village called Sankara in Subarnpur district of Odisha, India. They applied for a loan of 150,000 INR from Peoples Forum.

One woman in this group is named Nandini; she is the lady standing with her raised hand in the rear row. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in their own house in a poor area. Nandini has been selling cosmetics and fancy fashion items door to door for more than seven years.

She works very hard in order to provide her family with necessities, but her income and capital are not enough to do that, and she does not have enough inventory to meet demand. Day by day, Nandini's capital decreases more and more. For this reason, she applied for financial support and took out a loan of 15,000 INR (her portion in this group loan) in order to enlarge her business by purchasing more cosmetics and fashion items for resale.

Nandini hopes to eventually open a small store for all kinds of perfumes and incense.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and fashion items to resell and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Uma Rubab

texts.en:
Uma Rubab is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman who has two children. 

Uma Rubab has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Her work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Uma Rubab has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
“Maa Samaleswari Self-help Group” is a group that consists of nine determined women. Saptami, the group president, is a 31-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child. For this reason, she is motivated to succeed.

Saptami sells cosmetics and new clothing. She started this business six years ago with the severance pay she received from the company where she previously worked. Saptami, along with her group, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum in order to buy body creams, hair and body oil, perfumes for men and women, T-shirts, shorts, trousers, and other items so that she can meet the demand for these products.

The other members are engaged in different activities such as grocery shop, milk selling, fruits and vegetables selling, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
 Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido superando su situación de pobreza, gracias a las capacitaciones y asesoramiento que ha ido recibiendo. Ella se dedica a hacer chipas, el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo,  y después sale a venderlos. Como la chipa se come siempre en todo el año, es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus chipas, como ser harina de maíz, almidón, queso, huevo, anís, manteca y demás, y de esta forma ir mejorando sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
La Esperanza is doing the Elimination of Poverty Survey through which the life situation of each can be assessed and they can keep improving their living conditions for themselves and their families accordingly. 

One of the members is Sandra who, in the latest survey, showed a level of poverty of three which means that she has overcome her poverty thanks to the training and advice that she has been receiving. She makes cheese-stuffed buns called chipas which are a typical Paraguayan food. She then goes to sell them. As chipas are eaten throughout the year she has a good clientele. 

She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of several ingredients to make her chipas such as flour, corn starch, cheese, eggs, anise, butter, and others. She will therefore improve the income going to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make the traditional Paraguayan food called chipas

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony, a 49-year-old married woman from Iloilo, Philippines, has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than four years now. Fishing is a good venture in their area

Leony is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. These purchases will enable her and her husband to improve their catch and thus their income.

In the future, Leony hopes to make their business a real success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela  raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 29-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 1. Her husband earns an income by being a carpenter. Together with her family, she lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.

She has been raising hogs for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed. In this way, Carmela could raise and sell more healthy pigs. She could earn a higher income. This could help her to hold back her capital for any possible business ventures to augment income.

Carmelita would like to expand her hog raising business, become more productive and improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has three dependents aged 10, 12 and 19. Her husband fishes for a living while Leonora raises hogs to supplement his income. Along the way, Leonora learned fishing too, and she always helps her husband in any way. 

With this, Leonora is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, crude oil and more piglets to raise. 

Leonora hopes that this will help so that she can provide for her children's basic needs like food, clothes and school fees. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to a buy fishing net, crude oil and piglets

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita owns and operates an eatery. She cooks and sells homemade meals. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling canned goods, noodles, biscuits, seasonings, and soft drinks. She is a 44-year-old married woman with three children aged 12, 9, and 6.
She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods and supplies for the eatery like rice, meat, vegetables, and seasonings. This will help Carmelita cook other  menus to serve her customers. Her store will be filled again with a variety of stock, and she will roll back her capital. She will now be able to continue to finance the schooling of her children and provide them with better shelter.
In the future, Carmelita dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods  and supplies  for the  eatery like rice, meat, vegetables, and seasonings

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santo Rey está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una ciudad muy alejada de la capital, que aun está en constante crecimiento, muchas de sus integrantes se dedican a actividades eminentemente rurales.
La Sra. Lira es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su peluquería  y también sale a realizar trabajos a domicilio, y por las noches estudia en la facultad. Es una mujer muy luchadora, que se está esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, y a la vez trabaja de una manera muy honesta.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called "Santo Rey" is in their 2nd loan cycle in the Woman's Committee Program. They live in the city of Concepción, a city that is far from the capital. It is still in continual growth and many of the members work in distinctly rural businesses.

Lira is one of the members. She is from an area that is far from the city center where she has her hair salon. She also goes out and does domestic work. At night she studies at university. She is a fighter who has made an effort to be somebody in life and at the same time work very honestly.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her hair salon like shampoo, rinse, dye, cream and others. In this way she can continue to expand her business and give her family what they need to live without hardships.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinse, dye, cream and others for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maravilla se formo en la ciudad de Concepción, una ciudad bastante alejada de la zona céntrica del país, eminentemente rural, que está creciendo poco a poco.
La Sra.  Cornelia es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus ropas y Zapatos usados. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona y sus compañeras de comité puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de calzados y prendas varias para la venta. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named Maravilla was formed in the city of Concepcion, a city a long way from the central area of the country, predominantly rural, which is growing little by little.

Cornelia is one of the members. She is from an area away from the center of the city where she goes to sell her used clothing and shoes. She hopes that as time passes, and through the help of all of the people in her area and her colleagues on the committee, they will be able to improve their environment and in that way offer more security to their families and also provide them with a better future. 

She is requesting this loan to buy footwear and various clothing to sell. In this way, she will be able to continue growing her business and give her family what they need in order to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan, aged 46, is a married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of her household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Hameedan has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 27-year-old refugee. He is married and has two smart sons. His family lives in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement. The settlement is built in Bilesuvar, and it is very big because the number of refugees is very high. Elchin's wife is a houskeeper. She is very kind and friendly, and she takes care of the children and family. 

Elchin helps his family by working as a gardener. He raises different fruits and vegetables, then he sells these products at the local bazaar. Azerbaijan is a very rich land, and people grow different fruits and vegetables. They sell them fresh or dried because people like to use dried fruit for different delicious dishes.	
				
Elchin earns 220 AZN monthly from selling his harvest at the local bazaar. This amount is very small and doesn’t cover his family's needs. Elchin plans to plant new fruit seeds and increase the productivity of his garden. He applied for a 700 AZN loan and will buy new seeds and fertilizers. This will improve his garden's productivity and increase his income. Elchin will be able to pay for his children's education and the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
EL Sr. Alcides tiene una Bodega en su casa, también un lavadero de autos y motos, comenta que empezó hace 4 con un pequeño copetín, después con mucho esfuerzo fue agrandando lo que ahora es una bodega, y su lavadero, es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
Comenta que el préstamo que pide es para poder surtir su bodega, con todo tipo de bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, energizantes y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alcides runs a local store in his house as well as a carwash for cars and motorbikes. He says that he started 4 years ago with a small counter, but after a lot of hard work his business expanded and became what is now his local store and carwash. He is a very hardworking and extremely determined person. 

He says that the loan that he is asking is to stock his store with all types of drinks such as beer, wine, fizzy drinks, energy drinks and others. This would enable him to carry on working as he has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine, fizzy drinks, energy drinks and other drinks to stock his local store.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” es un grupo que está conformada por socias empeñosas en mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Margarita tiene 66 años de edad es casada con hijos todos independientes. Ella se dedica a la producción de frutas que crecen en la zona en el cual radica y a la vez teje a pedido de sus conocidos elabora postres para su consumo y expender  a sus vecinos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos y lana para sus tejidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado Margarita es la primera persona sentado del lado izquierdo viste chompa a rayas de color lila negro beige blanco y rojo.
texts.en:
The Señor del Rimac Group is made up of members committed to improving their financial earnings.

Margarita is 66 years old. She is married with independent children. She is dedicated to the production of fruit that grows in the area where she resides and at the same time she weaves by requests from her acquaintances and makes desserts for her consumption and to sell to her neighbors. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve her crops and wool for her weavings. 

The group thanks the Kiva loaners for the credit provided to Margarita who is the first person sitting on the left wearing a striped sweater of lilac, black, beige, white, and red.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wool for weavings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a retail location to develop her independent beauty salon business.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año, y trabaja como manicurista.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, generosa, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de “el torno” un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola de; carne, verduras y granos. Productores campesinos y distribuidores de la ciudad se agrupan para comprar y vender. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio (al centro, usa solera amarilla, pantalón azul). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte libre y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, los menores todavía están al cuidado de su madre. Los deseos por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la llevaron a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta y venta de tomates, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la manicura, ella tiene por ocupación el cuidado y embellecimiento de las manos y en especial, el cuidado y pintura de las uñas. Labor que realiza por las mañanas en un centro de estética y por las tardes y noches en una peluquería. Entre sus ocupaciones se encuentra el corte, limpieza y pulido de las uñas de los clientes tanto de las manos como de los pies. Para ello, primero retira la pintura anterior utilizando acetona. Luego, corta y perfila la forma de las uñas utilizando tijeras y limas. Para ablandar las cutículas del cliente se ayuda de agua y aceite y para limpiarlas de asperezas y recortarlas utiliza cuchillos y tijeras especiales. Su trabajo lo realiza de martes a domingo en ambos lugares. “El cuidado de nuestras manos habla mucho de nuestra persona. La impresión que dejan unas manos limpias, con uñas bien cortadas y con un buen tono de esmalte, es difícil de rebasar...” comenta. Su sueño es ser independiente y tener su propio salón de uñas. Ella desea independizarse mediante la apertura de un salón de uñas para atender a muchos clientes y ser su propio jefe. Para esto ella debe comprar; Limas de cartón, Cepillos para uñas, Palito de naranjo, 
Corta cutículas o Alicates, Polisher o pulidor de uñas, Piedra pómez, sillas, Recipiente para colocar los dedos, Reverbero para calentar el aceite, Un cojín pequeño para que el cliente descanse sus brazos, y otros. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para abrir su salón de uñas, independizarse y atender a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 25-year-old woman who lives with her partner and her three children (ages 6, 4, and 1). She works as a manicurist. Virginia is a good mother with a positive attitude. She is also enterprising, optimistic, cheerful, generous, friendly, responsible, and hardworking.

She conducts business in the town of El Torno, a rural area that is known for its agriculture trade involving meat, vegetables, and grains. Rural producers and distributors from the city gather together so that they can buy and sell. This area has a tropical, warm, and humid climate. The air temperature can vary throughout the day between 21 to 35 degrees centigrade.

Virginia has a dark complexion, long black hair, and a short stature. Her native language is Guaraní, but she speaks Spanish as part of the general culture and for engaging in trade. In the photo she standing in the middle, wearing a yellow top and blue track pants. Her life with her partner involves moving around freely and being with her children. Her oldest child is in school while the younger ones are being cared for by her mother.

Virginia wanted to improve her family’s quality of life, so she started a Communal Bank with other business people who sell sandwiches, make handicrafts, sell soft drinks, manage a bookstore, sell clothes, sell fruit, and sell tomatoes. As a result, they are able to request a loan so that they can expand their businesses.

Virginia’s business is working as a manicurist. She keeps herself busy by taking care of and embellishing the hands, specifically giving attention to the nails and painting them. Virginia works at an aesthetician’s center in the mornings and at a beauty salon in the afternoons and evenings. Her duties include cutting, cleaning, and filing the nails of her clients, both on the hands and feet. The first thing she does is remove the old nail polish with acetone. She then trims and files the nails by using clippers and an emery board. In order to soften her client’s cuticles, she soaks them in a mixture of oil and water. To clean rough patches, she re-trims those areas by using pushers and special scissors.

Virginia works Tuesday through Sunday at both locations. “How we take care of our hands says a lot about ourselves. The impression left by clean hands, well-trimmed nails, and a good coat of polish is difficult to overlook,” she says. Her dream is to become independent and open her own nail salon. She wants to become independent because she can attend to more clients and become her own boss. For this reason, she is seeking to buy emery boards, nail brushes, wooden cuticle pushers, cuticle nippers and pliers, a nail polisher, pumice stones, chairs, hand soaking receptacles, a heating element for warming oil, small cushions on which clients can rest their arms, and other supplies. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender.

Virginia has been in this line of work for 10 years. For the many reasons that have been mentioned, she is requesting a loan so that she can open her nail salon, become independent, and attend to her many clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment so that she can open her nail salon, become independent, and attend to her many clients.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 50-year-old vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of five children. 

Bashiran has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  

Bashiran’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone.

Bashiran wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet customers' demands consistently to gain more profits for opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet customers' demands consistently

loans.name: Chaman

texts.en:
Chaman, 23 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with the support of her brother, shown with her in the photo. They offer a variety of daily-use products and make a good income that supports the needs of the family members. 

In order to avoid shortages, Chaman has requested a loan of PKR 40000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. This will allow them to consistently meet increasing demand and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 39 years old and married. She has three children. Farzana is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. This monetary help will bring Farzana closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time

loans.name: Idelso

texts.es:
Idelso tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de café, cuenta con 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiendo de su cultivo de café, con esto Idelso espera aumentar la calidad de su cosecha, ofreciendo un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Idelso is 38 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The district’s population mainly works in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

He is a farmer, and he mainly grows coffee.  He has eight years of experience in the business, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

The present loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crop.  With this, Idelso hopes to improve the quality of his harvest and offer a better product to his customers.  This will be reflected in a higher level of income and, therefore, a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 41 years old and widowed with 3 children. She is a farmer in Thika town, and from the sale of the farm produce she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on her farm

loans.name: Ricart

texts.es:
Ricart de 48 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia Cutervo,región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú, en donde se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad así como al comercio de animales menores.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales menores como gallinas, pavos y cuyes, etc, hace 8 años.Con el préstamo solicitado realizará la compra de una variedad de abarrotes para abastecer su bodega y poder ofrecer a sus clientes, así mismo construirá corrales para la cría de animales, para así obtener mayores ingresos para tener un mejor calidad de vida su familia y él. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como comerciales.
texts.en:
Ricart, age 48, lives with his wife and son in the Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  He sells basic needs supplies, and he also sells small animals.  He has been raising and selling small animals like chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs, etc. for eight years.

He will use the requested loan to buy a variety of groceries to stock his store and offer to his customers.  He will also build corrals for raising the animals.  This way he will get greater earnings in order to have a better quality of life for himself and for his family.  He has very good very good personal and business references.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to stock his store and offer to his customers.  He will also build corrals for raising the animals.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, a 32-year-old married mother of four, has been selling clothes in the town of Thika for 10 years. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional shirts, blouses, skirts and trousers to sell and intends to buy more with the anticipated profits. 

This will be Rebecca's her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, her previous loans completely repaid. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nthiiri

texts.en:
Nthiiri has a motorcycle transport business in Thika town. He is 55 years old, married to Nancy and they have been blessed with 2 children.  He has been in this business for 20 years and right now he makes a monthly income of 22,000 KES.

His spouse has a retail shop and she provides additional income to support the family. He will use this loan to support his wife's business by buying more stock of sugar, tea leaves, soap and cooking oil for selling in her retail shop. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to expand his wife's retail shop business by buying more stock of goods for selling

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Teresa, a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on Earth that favors farming.

Teresa is the proud mother of six lovely children, whom she adores and always protects. Teresa’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Teresa is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her six children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Teresa is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Teresa is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change.

Through the income from horticultural farming, Teresa will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 58 years old. She is married with eight children between 23 and 35 years old, two of whom go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy  fertilizers to grow maize and to sell them. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers to grow  maize and to sell them.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 5 and 17. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 6 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow beans and maize, which he will then sell at the local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Omm Sriya Shg Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sasmita has a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. She will use her portion to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing for sale.

Sasmita is 29 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Omm Sriya Self-help Group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Subarnpur district, a rural area in Odisha state, India.

In 2009, Sasmita joined Peoples Forum. She has been involved in this business for more than five years, and the main hardship that Sasmita faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Sasmita hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 38 years old. She is married with four children between 3 and 22 years old, three of whom go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize, which she will then sell at the local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 27 years old. He is not married. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize, which he will sell at the local market. The profits from the business will be used to buy food.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Unidas por el Progreso, el grupo lleva este nombre debido a que sus integrantes se unieron y formaron en el comité para trabajar y progresar juntas respaldadas por el programa de comité de mujeres que implementa la fundación paraguaya.
La Sra. Rosa, es una de las socias de este grupo, se caracteriza por ser muy activa, es una señora joven, responsable y muy trabajadora. Se desempeña como empleada doméstica y viendo la necesidad de poder ayudar  un poco más a su familia, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza y a través de esto poder luchar por mejorar cada día mas por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This loan committee is called Unidadas Por El Progreso [United for Progress]. This group is so named because its members came together and formed the committee to work and progress together supported by the Committee of Women Program implemented by Fundación Paraguaya. 

Rosa is one of the members of this group. She is characterized by being very active. She is a young, responsible, and hardworking woman. She works as a maid and, in seeing the need to help her family a little more, she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of materials for making and selling cleaning products. Through this she will have the ability to work hard to improve everyday for her loved ones.

loans.use: to make and sell cleaning products

loans.name: Zarinamo

texts.ru: Заринамо умелая мастерица в возрасте 26 лет. Она живет в столице и предоставляет свои услуги швеи. Она начала свой швейный бизнес три года назад. Заринамо шьет платья разных национальных фасонов, которые создает сама. Она влюблена в свою профессию и довольна тем, что еще в свое время она научилась этой деятельности самостоятельно. Благодаря этой деятельности она кормит свою семью. У Заринамо маленькие дети, а муж находится в России на заработках. Заринамо сейчас остро нуждается в заемных средствах. Ей необходимо закупить необходимые швейные принадлежности, чтобы продолжить шитье. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом. Заринамо ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Zarinamo is a skilled, 26-year-old artisan. She lives in the capital and provides sewing services. She started her sewing business three years ago. Zarinamo sews various national-style dresses that she creates herself. She is in love with her profession and is happy that she learned this business independently in her time. She provides for her family, thanks to this business. Zarinamo has young children, and husband works in Russia. Zarinamo now really needs a loan. She has to purchase sewing accessories in order to continue sewing. She requested a loan for this purpose. Zarinamo awaits support.

loans.use: to purchase sewing accessories in order to continue sewing

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 20 year old who lives with her 8 siblings and parents in Mafraq.

Rawan was not able to enroll in a university directly after high school because of the high tuition rate. She badly wanted to continue with her studies, so she went to a small college to study nursing and got a diploma degree. She also used to work to make some money that she saved to enroll herself in a university. She did so, but today Rawan is facing some shortage in the tuition fees for her next semester. That is why she is applying for this loan

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her next semester.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila  is 48 years old and married to the man in the photo, who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to remain functional. 

Jamila has requested a loan of 40000 PKR for her husband to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. 

Jamila  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom has successfully built her business of selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. 

Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats, to increase her sales to more cities for gaining more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats, to increase her sales to more cities for gaining more profits.

loans.name: Elton

texts.en:
Elton is 36 years old and married. He has a little 10 month old child. He owns a bar café that is frequented mostly by men in the neighborhood, and he is photographed inside the cafe. Kindly note that most of the time, neighborhood cafés are places where men of almost every age can go and talk mostly about politics and day-to-day happenings. This is the only source of income for the entire family. His elderly father, who lives with them as well, receives a retirement pension. 
Elton is seeking your financial help to add a kitchen to his bar café, since he’s got plans to change the setting and start serving food as well.

loans.use: to add a kitchen to his bar café as well to start serving food

loans.name: Mujeres De Yguazu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres del Yguazu está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer mejor la situación de pobreza de cada una de las integrantes del grupo y conforme a ello capacitarlas para poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que se encuentra en una pobreza extrema. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa podrá ir mejorando su situación. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de helados, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia en lo que puede.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de helados variados, de manera a poder tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres del Yguazu is part of the elimination of poverty program, which allows them to have a better understanding of the poverty situation of each of its members, and to enable them to improve accordingly.

One of the members is Teresa, who in her survey showed a level of poverty within level one, which means she is living in extreme poverty. Through effort, continuous work and the application of essential behaviors of a successful woman, she will be able to improve her situation. Among the work that she does, she makes a living selling ice cream. And, through this work, she helps her family as much as she can.

She is requesting this loan to buy various flavors of ice cream in order to be able to have a greater variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various flavors of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia Doris se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Doris continues with her business of selling beauty products.  She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.  Through this business she wants to get ahead.  

She is an enterprising and tenacious woman.

She is requesting the loan to buy lipsticks and perfumes.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Gladys Argentina

texts.es:
La  señora Gladys de 60 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus cuatro hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea  de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan.
Doña Gladys se dedica desde hace  ya varios años a la elaboración y venta de pan se levanta desde muy temprano todo los días a fabricar el pan para luego viajar al mercado con la ayuda de sus dos hijas quiénes le ayudan en su negocio.
Doña Gladys solicita el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, manteca, cuajada, etc. que son los productos esenciales para elaborar sus rosquillas y pan, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante y le genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es aumentar su clientela para mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Gladys, 60, is a single mother.  She lives with her four children in her home in a town in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  Her business is making and selling bread.

Gladys has earned a living for several years now making and selling bread.  She gets up very early every day to make the bread and then go to the market with the help of her two daughters who help her with her business.

Gladys is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood, shortening, curd cheese, and other essential ingredients to make her "rosquillas" [ring-shaped pastry] and bread.  She hopes this investment will allow her to get ahead and earn the income she needs to improve her quality of life and her family's.

Her dream is to expand her clientele so she can improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, December 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, shortening, curd cheese, and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad rural, que aun está en crecimiento, es un poco alejada de la zona de la capital del país.
La Sra. Rosa es la tesorera  del comité, ella tiene una pequeña despensa, desea ir mejorando poco a poco su vida por medio de su trabajo y sumada a las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya. Es una persona muy trabajadora, que demuestra sus ganas de superación por medio de su entusiasmo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, bebidas, panificados y demás, agradece también por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its third cycle with the women’s committee program.  It is from the city of Curuguaty, a rural city that is still growing.  It is a bit far from the capital of the country.

Rosa is the treasurer of the group.  She has a small store.  She wishes to be improving, little by little, her life.  She will do this through her work and by the training that she will be getting from the Fundación Paraguaya.  She is a very hard-working person who demonstrates her desire for self-improvement through her enthusiasm.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various supplies for her store.  She will buy things like vegetables, fruit, canned goods, drinks, baked goods, and others.  She is grateful for this opportunity she is getting, and it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, drinks, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Wiliams

texts.es:
Wiliams es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometido con su trabajo, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra ubicado en cercanías al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío con una temperatura que varía en el transcurso del día entre 2-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Wiliams es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la elaboración de derivados lácteos, viven en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable.
