Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se encarga de comprar ganado para engordarlo y prepararlo para la producción de leche, una vez gordo realiza la venta en la feria del mismo lugar los días sábado a las 5 de la mañana. “la crianza de ganado es una labor familiar que viene desde mis abuelos y sus abuelos, el forraje es escaso y requiere mucho esfuerzo y trabajo para conseguirlo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un establo grande y con todas la comodidades para su ganado. Él desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para su engorde y comercio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Wiliams solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para su engorde y comercio.
texts.en:
Wiliams, 37, is married and has no children.  His business is selling livestock.  He's a happy, optimistic, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking man with a good attitude who's committed to his job.

He works in the community of Batallas, located near Lake Titicaca, an agricultural region where people raise cattle and sheep and live on fish and local vegetables such as quinoa, chuño [freeze-dried potato], beans, potatoes, etc.  The climate is cold with a temperature that varies from 2 to 12 degrees centigrade during the day, and the rays of the sun beat down on the ground.

Wiliams is short and dark, and has short black hair.  His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for everyday use and for business.  He lives with his wife who, works making dairy products.  They lives in an adobe house that has electricity and potable water.

His business is selling cattle.  He buys cattle to fatten and prepare for milk production.  Once fat, he sells them in the town in the same place at 5 in the morning on Saturdays.  "Raising cattle is a family trade that came from my grandparents and their grandparents.  Fodder is scarce, and it requires a lot of effort and work to get it," he said.  His dream is to have a large stable with all the conveniences for his cattle.

Wiliams wants to buy dairy cattle to fatten and sell.  This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 15 years he has been in business for himself.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to fatten and sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old. He is married, and together with his wife they have been blessed with four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 10 years old. He sells energy-saving cookstoves, a business that makes him earn a monthly income of KES 6,000.

David has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 7,000, which he intends to use to purchase more energy saving and environment-friendly cookstoves. With the anticipated profits, He will be able to pay school fees for his children. His hope and dream for the future is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more energy-saving and environment-friendly cookstoves to resell

loans.name: El Mosaico Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Mosaico lo integran cinco mujeres exitosas, quien lo coordina es la señora Neris una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace un año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones para damas, caballeros, camisetas, blusas, sandalias, etc., es el tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. El resto de los integrantes son, Rosibel una mujer de 53 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, además ofrece el servicio de venta de fritanga, Genara de 49 años de edad, comerciante de calzado y recargas para celulares movistar y claro, en  su domicilio y ambulante en su comunidad desde hace un año, Socorro de 31 años de edad comerciante de ropa de segunda y gaseosas en su domicilio y ambulante desde hace un año, y María de 41 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The "Mosaico" communal bank is made up of five successful women. The coordinator is Señora Neris, who is a single 40-year-old woman who has earned her living selling new clothing in her community for one year. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of pants for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, etc. This is the third time that ADIM has provided financing for her business, and she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person.

The rest of the members are Rosibel, a 53-year-old woman whose business is the sale of fruits and vegetables, as well as offering fried foods for sale; Genera, who is 49 years old and has sold footwear and Movistar and Claro prepaid mobile phone minutes from her house and on the streets of her community for one year; Socorro, who is  31 years old and has been a seller of second-hand clothing and soft drinks from her house and on the streets for one year; and María, who is 41 years old and has been the owner of a small neighborhood grocery for three years.

loans.use: to buy pants for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 54 years old. He is married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 32 years old. Five of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for four years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize, which he will sell at the local market after harvest. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Juvenar

texts.en:
Givenard is 64 years old. He is married with seven children aged between 8 and 33 years; 6 of them go to school. He has farmed for 25 years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize. He will sell his maize harvest at the local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jeanbatiste

texts.en:
Jeanbatiste is 32 years old, a married man with 3- and 7-year-olds. Both children attend school. He has been farming for 15 years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize. After the harvest, he will sell the maize at a local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Dioresis Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dioresis, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y una de 15 años, los dos menores  estudia en universidad y colegio  y son  los que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Dioresis es un ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa, zapatos, productos naturales y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja dos o tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en horas de la noche, la mayoría de sus productos son para entregar ya que cuenta con mucha clientela que ha logrado en más de 20 años que lleva en esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, productos naturales, cremas y cosméticos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que todos sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Andrés communal bank meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño community in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that people visit year-round and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

This is where Dioresis, age 51, lives.  She is married, and they have three children.  Two of the children are adults, and one is 15 years old.  The youngest two attend the university and the local school.  They are the ones that still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.

Dioresis is a housewife who, in order to help her husband with the expenses, works in commerce.  She sells clothes, shoes, natural products and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door.  She works two or three hours a day whether it be in the morning or in the evening hours.  Most of her products are for delivery.  She has managed to acquire a lot of clientele in the over 20 years she has been engaged in this business activity.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfume, natural products, creams, and cosmetics.  She is the founder of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help that the loans provide.  Her dream is for all of her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, natural products, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Two of them go to school. He has farmed for 25 years and will use this loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize. After the harvest, he will sell the maize at the local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is 31 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 3 months and 10 years old, two of them go to school. He has been in farming for 8 years and will use the loan from Kiva, to buy fertilizers to grow maize. After the harvest, he will sell the maize at a local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with three children. He has a motorcycle transport business and a shoe shining business in Narok and has been in this business for 10 years. 
He will be using this loan to buy shoes to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 
This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a single woman. She has five siblings, and they live with their parents in Mafraq, Jordan. Haneen is the oldest of the children, and she a university student. Her father is their only provider; he has a retirement salary and works with a small pick-up car transporting stuff for people. His car broke down and he had to use some of the money he saved to pay for Haneen’s school to fix the car. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna is a conservative married woman, so she asked her husband, Baker, to appear in the photo instead. Muna is a 38-year-old, mother for three children. She opened a small food store next to her house where she can work while her children are at school. In the afternoon, her husband takes her place so she can rest at home and be with the children. She is applying for a loan to put safety bars on the windows of her food store.

loans.use: to put safety bars on the windows of her food store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clean energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Kaweluwelu Group

texts.en:
Maggie is 40 years old and has 6 children. Only two of her children go to school.

She sustains her family by selling chickens. She started this business in order to reduce poverty in her home and to have an additional source of income. She will use the loan to buy more chickens and chicken feed. 

Her main goal is to raise more chickens and sell them to institutions like boarding schools and restaurants. She dreams of building a good house and sending her children to private school. The loans have helped her to sufficiently support her family without relying on her husband.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Gs Song Taaba Rabele Group

texts.fr: GS Song taaba rabele est le premier groupe que ACFIME a posté sur le site Kiva. Ce groupe a fait son remboursement en intégralité. SAFIATA avait pu acheter le charbon stocker pour vendre avec son prêt.Elle a pu aussi aider son mari dans la gestion de leur famille. Avec ses économies et son bénéfice, elle a pu ouvrir un kiosque. Elle a besoin de prêt pour continuer la vente du charbon et gérer son kiosque. En effet dans son kiosque, elle fait du thé, du nescafé et fait un peu de restauration. Pour la bonne marche de ses activités, SAFIATA a employé quelqu'un qui s'occupe de son kiosque et qu'elle rémunéré chaque mois. Ce prêt aidera SAFIATA à renforcer ses activités et les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
GS Song Taaba Rabele is the first group posted by ACFIME on the Kiva website. The group fully reimbursed its loan.

With the loan Safiata was able to buy and store charcoal for resale. She was also able to help her husband in managing their family. With her savings and earnings, she was able to open a stall.

She needs the loan to continue selling charcoal and manage her stall. She prepares tea and instant coffee in her stall and does some catering. For the smooth running of her business, Safiata employs someone who takes cares of her stall and is paid each month.

This loan will help Safiata to bolster her activities, and the profits will enable her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: buy charcoal for resale and help her manage her stall

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 41 year old, married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family. Noor is a loving mother of 6 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfil their basic necessities through this business.

For the improvement of her husband's business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which will ultimately help them to cover their utility bills in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately will help to cover her utility bills in a timely manner.

loans.name: Furqat

texts.ru: Фуркат отец большого семейства сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с 2012 года. Он занимается откормом скота.  Кроме откорма скота Фуркат также занимается деканством, он имеет 1,5 га земли где выращивает картофель и зерновые культуры. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки скота.  Клиент рад что сотрудничает с МДО Арванд где его всегда поддерживают и он намерен в дальнейшем продолжить свое сотрудничество.
texts.en: Furqat is the father of a large family.  He has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2012.  He is involved in cattle fattening and farming; he owns 1.5 hectare of land on which he grows potatoes and cereals.  He is taking a loan to buy livestock.  Furqat is happy to be collaborating with MDO Arvand, because he feels that the institution is always supporting him.  He intends to pursue his collaboration with MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Marangatu está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que tiene mucho entusiasmo y afán de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Están formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual y por medio de capacitaciones irán mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, un trabajo muy sacrificado que hace para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más pollos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Todas y cada una de las integrantes agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben de poder salir de la pobreza extrema, de manera a poder ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Kuña Marangatu group is in the 8th cycle of its women's committee program. It is a group of people who have a lot of enthusiasm and ambition to be able to grow and improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are part of the poverty elimination program. Through the program, and through trainings, they will go on improving their impoverished situation. 

One of the members is Maria, who in her survey demonstrated a level one poverty level, which is extreme poverty. She makes a living in chicken sales, which is a very demanding job that she does to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She is a very hardworking and, above all, determined woman. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy more chickens, in order to be able to continue her work as she has been doing. All of the members appreciate the opportunity that they have received to be able to escape from extreme poverty and to be able to help their families.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Эту женщину из района Джиликуль зовут Салима. Ей 44 года. Она мать четверых детей, которым по 22, 20, 14 и 8 лет. Двое старших сыновей работают трудовыми мигрантами в России, а младшие дети еще школьники. Муж Салимы работает вместе с женой в дехкансокм хозяйстве. Они в течение 28 лет занимаются посевом сельскохозяйственных культур и являются опытными растениеводами. Помимо посева урожая, они еще и занимаются животноводством. Целью кредита является сельскохозяйственная деятельность. Салима на сумму кредита собирается приобрести минеральные удобрения для будущего урожая. Благодаря кредиту она сможет собрать качественный и хороший урожай.
texts.en: The name of this woman from the Jilikul district is Salima. She is 44 years old. She is a mother of four children, who are 22, 20, 14 and 8 years old. Two of her oldest sons work as migrant workers in Russia, and the younger children are still school students. Salima's husband works with his wife on a dekhan farm. They have been involved in growing agricultural crops for 28 years and are expert farmers. Besides planting crops, they are also involved in animal husbandry. The focus of this loan is their agricultural business. Salima is planning to use the loan amount to buy mineral fertilizers for the future harvest. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to gather a quality and good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase yarn, fabric, and needles to make handicrafts

loans.name: Davlyatmo

texts.ru:
Давлятмо трудолюбивая сельская женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она занимается растениеводством и на протяжении 29 лет трудится на земле. 
Давлятмо живет с мужем-фермером и четырьмя детьми в районе Джиликуль. Территория района расположена в пределах нижней части долины реки Вахш, южная окраина района имеет государственную границу с Афганистаном, проходящую по реке Пяндж. Климат района Джиликуль благоприятен для ведения сельского хозяйства. Поэтому жители района активно занимаются растениеводством и животноводством. 
Давлятмо занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур вместе с мужем. Это у них семейный бизнес и главный источник дохода. В данный момент Давлятмо и ее муж готовят почву к зимнему посеву. За счет суммы кредита они хотели бы приобрести семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения. Без финансовой поддержки они не смогут провести посев. Они нуждаются в вашей помощи.
texts.en: Davlyatmo is hardworking, rural 45-year-old woman. She has been involved in agriculture for 29 years and works on the land. Davlyatmo lives with her farmer-husband and four children in the Jilikul district. The district territory is situated within the borders of the lower valley of the river Vakhsh. The southern part of the district has a national border with Afghanistan, running along the river Pyandj. The climate in the Jilikul district is favorable for running an agricultural business. This is why the district residents are actively involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. Davlyatmo and her husband are involved in growing agricultural crops. This is their family business and the primary source of income. At the present time, Davlyatmo and her husband and readying the soil for the winter sowing. They want to use the loan amount to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers. She will not be able to proceed with the sowing without this financial support. They need your help.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: Elisa de 54 años de edad es conviviente. Ella actualmente pertenece al grupo “Señor De Los Milagros”  constituida por 06 mujeres responsables y emprendedoras.  Elisa de dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de comida como papa rellena y mazamorra morada los fines de semana. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de arroz, frejol, leche y aceite. El grupo “Señor De Los Milagros” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Elisa se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo azul.
texts.en:
Elisa is 54 years old and is in a domestic partnership. Currently, she belongs to the “Señor De Los Milagros” group which is made up of 6 responsible and entrepreneurial women.

Elisa makes a living selling groceries. She also earns her living selling food like stuffed potatoes and mazamorra morada [purple corn pudding] on the weekends. She will use this latest loan to buy rice, beans, milk, and oil.

The “Señor De Los Milagros” group thanks the people who make this loan possible. Elisa is the second person from the left, sitting down and wearing a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La socia Roamery se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,su sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papeles para la fotocopiadora.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member Rosmery continues to make a living through her photocopying business, and through this business she wants to move forward in life. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She is requesting the loan to buy paper for the photocopier.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy paper for the photocopier.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with one child. She has a retail and a stationary business in Narok and has been in this business for 10 years. 
She will be using this loan to buy more stock of stationary such as exercise books, files, staples and envelopes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy stationary to sell. 
This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stationary to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her pay for her semester fees that will allow her to register for the second semester without having to take a break.

loans.name: Mauro Adán

texts.es:
Mauro, de 65 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y su pareja trabaja en la venta de verduras.- Es padre de nueve hijos, solo cuatro viven con él, los demás ya tienen sus propios hogares.

Mauro, se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y siembra de hortalizas, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 45 años, dicho oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, su trabajo está a 500 metros de su casa aproximadamente, su hora de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Mauro, está solicitando el crédito para comprar 4 vacas, esto ayudará a tener mas producción tanto en su hato lechero como ganadero, de esa manera ayudará a mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familiar.

Mauro, sueña con ampliar su ganadería, poder remodelar su casa y ayudarle a sus hijos hasta que logren obtenier un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Mauro, age 65, did not have the chance to go to school.  He is married, and his life partner works selling vegetables.  He has nine children.  Only four of them live with him.  The others now have their own households.

Mauro devotes himself to agriculture and livestock, and he grows vegetables.  He has been doing this work for 45 years.  He learned this line of work from his parents.  His work is approximately 500 meters from his house.  His work hours are from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

Mauro is requesting the loan to buy four cows.  This will help him to have greater dairy and livestock production.  This way he will help improve his family’s living conditions.

Mauro dreams of expanding his livestock business, being able to remodel his house, and helping his children until they manage to get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy four cows.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke  (or ‘Easter’ in English) wants to buy a dairy cow, specifically a spotted one.  Pashke is a 45-year-old, married mother of four children. The oldest one is 22, a daughter who has been suffering for years now with some illness, and due to this she stopped going to school when she turned 15, and the youngest child is 12. All three other children are going to schools respectively. 

Pashke generates some income from the livestock activity she’s been pursuing for some years now, having three cows and selling raw milk and three baby calves a year. Her husband works in the construction field.

loans.use: to buy a spotted dairy cow.

loans.name: Vasilika

texts.en: Vasilika's husband is a welder by occupation, and he needs a vehicle to carry his tools and other items to his clients.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Hayatan

texts.en:
Hayatan is a 52 year old married woman. She runs a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Hayatan ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Hayatan has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Las Pasionarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Pasionarias está en su 10° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante con tener un mejor bienestar social como económico. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja duro todos los dias desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta ya muy tarde.
Al igual que la sra. Lidia todas las demás señoras estas activas trabajando por generar ingresos y mantenerse estables. Lidia pide este prestamo para la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, etc., para poder surtir su despensa.
texts.en:
The Passionflowers (Las Pasionarias) group is in its 10th committee cycle of enterprising women that all work and help each other get ahead and have both an improved economic and social well-being. They are completing the survey for the elimination of poverty, where two of them are below the poverty line.


One of the members is Lidia who through hard work, effort and the application of the essential behaviors of a successful woman, is improving her poverty. She makes a living through various sales, as she has a well-stocked pantry where she is hard at work every day from the early morning hours until late at night. 


Like Lidia, all of other active members work hard to generate income and maintain a stable life. Lidia asks for this loan to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, etc. to stock her pantry.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, etc. to stock her pantry

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta tiene 74 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Marta es una mujer increíble quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer un puesto de venta de variedad de ropa y accesorios de belleza desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos, por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa y accesorios como: faldas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa interior y variedad de accesorios de belleza)
texts.en:
Marta, age 74, lives in her own house with her family.  Marta is an incredible woman who, with much effort, has managed, a long time ago, to establish a stand selling a variety of clothes and beauty accessories.  This business is her main source of income.

Therefore, she wishes to keep it active for a much longer time.  In order to do so, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of clothes and accessories.  She will buy things like skirts, dresses, pants, underwear, and a variety of beauty accessories.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, pants, underwear, and a variety of beauty accessories.

loans.name: El Universo Group

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Mary es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa polera negra). Su sueños por mejorar su negocio la hizo conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de transporte, tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos en estado físico y por catálogo de forma ambulante. Cada día ella tiene una rutina de visitas en diferentes; mercados, tiendas comerciales, oficinas, etc. Llevando un bolsón lleno de productos y unas revistas también, para llegar a sus destinos debe caminar y viajar largas distancias en busca de clientes nuevos, bajo los fuertes rayos del sol y los cambios climáticos. “es importante conocer los ingredientes de los productos. ¿Por qué? Porque hay productos que tras aplicarlos atraviesan la barrera de nuestra piel. En la mayoría de los desodorantes se encuentra un componente dañino: el aluminio. hay muchos estudios que lo relacionan con el posible desarrollo del cáncer de mama…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de cosméticos para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de temporada y generar mejores ingresos para el bien de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Mary is a 28 year old woman, she lives with her partner, has two children who are 4 and 8 years old, and her business is selling cosmetics.

She is a good mother, entrepreneur, cheerful, optimistic, happy, has a good attitude, committed to her work, and very responsible. Her business is in the southern part of her city, where the weather is warm, tropical, and very humid with a constant temperature of approximately 30 degrees [86 degrees Fahrenheit] throughout the entire year.

Mary is dark-skinned, with black, long hair tied back. Her mother tongue is guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for the business she carries out (seated in the center, wearing a black shirt). Her dreams to improve her business led her to form a personal banking group of people with business such as: transportation services, video store, silverware sales, cell phone sales, chicken meat sales, flower sales, tea service, and a sewing workshop, in order to ask for a loan and to expand their businesses. 

Her business is selling cosmetics in person and through traveling catalog sales. Every day, she has a routine of visiting different markets, commercial stores, offices, etc. while carrying a backpack filled with products and some magazines as well. In order to get to her destinations she has to walk and travel large distances in search of new customers, beneath the strong rays of the sun and weather changes. 

"It is important to understand the ingredients of the products. Why? Because there are products that after applying them, go through the barrier of our skin.. In the majority of the deodorants, you can find a damaging component: aluminum. There are many studies that relate it with the possible development of breast cancer..." she comments. 

Her dream is to have a cosmetics store so that she can stop traveling. She wants to buy wholesale cosmetics to take advantage of the seasonal sales and generate better income for the good of her family. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the six years she has been doing this business. 

It is for those reasons that Mary is asking for a loan to buy wholesale cosmetics in order to supply her seasonal shoppers.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cosmetics to supply her seasonal shoppers

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en casa de material rústico caracterisco de la zona en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de café, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo, con esto Natividad espera producir una mejor cosecha, ofreciéndoles a sus clientes productos de alta calidad, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Natividad, 60, is married and lives with his spouse and his four children in a house made of modest materials that is typical of the area--the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He earns a living in agriculture, mainly growing coffee.  He has more than 10 years of experience in this field and has very good personal and business references in his area.

Natividad will use this loan to buy soil amendments and fertilizer to take proper care of his crop.  With this he hopes to produce a better harvest and offer his customers a high-quality product.  This will have a big impact on his level of income and increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer to take proper care of his crop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 37 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 8 years. Both children go to school. Charles sells foodstuffs, and he has been in a business for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy sorghum, beans, and maize to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy sorghum, beans, and maize to resell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio Javier se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio hace servicio de transporte, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Javier makes a living in the transportation business. He provides transportation services and works from 7:00 A.M. until 7:00 P.M. His dream is to buy a new car. 

The member is requesting this loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and he promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto lives in Hueyapan and is the father of three young boys. Alberto has worked in the field since he was little and when he has available time he does construction work around town for extra income. Alberto has built his house little by little. The house they live in is the result of almost 5 years of hard work and savings. He wishes to install a proper roof that will shelter him and his family during the cold winter nights. They have also seen that their youngest son has developed respiratory diseases and has a lot of trouble breathing normally during winter. Alberto makes around USD $500 a month. He has been saving for the last couple of months but is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials he needs to install a proper roof for his house. Alberto's job is informal with no way of proving his income, so accessing credit is a challenge. Alberto will work on the house and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets quality and safety standards. Alberto and his wife look forward to the day their kids can play and sleep with a proper roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper roof for his house

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, who is a 49-year-old married woman, lives in small village Dabla Gomi. She has a husband, a son, and a father-in-law who gets monthly pension from local government. Marina and her husband work hard to cover their family's increased needs. They are involved in agribusiness, cultivating a family-owned land and taking care of cattle. The family generates income from selling agricultural products at the local market. In spite of this, the family lives under poverty, having not enough money to exist.  

In order to generate income not only in season, Marina has decided to build a greenhouse. That's why she needs financial support to purchase all needed tools and materials. The start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, gave her a chance to expand her agribusiness and make the family a more stable income.  The loan will be great support for this hardworking woman and her family, as they will get a chance to live in normal conditions and satisfy their needs effectively. Marina awaits your support and kindness and relies on the good will of lenders.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es: Demecio de 50 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para poder darle lo mejor a su familia apoyado en su gran pasión como es la pesca ya que es gracias a este oficio que él puede sostener a su familia y disfrutar de su gusto por la misma. Demecio se siente feliz de poder contar con una manera de llevar el sustento a su hogar, pero la lancha en la que realiza su trabajo necesita de una reparación y de compra de repuestos ya que se encuentra dañada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: repuestos y mano de obra para reparar la lancha con la que realiza su trabajo y así poder seguir ganándose la vida de esta manera.
texts.en: Demecio, 50 years old, is a hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and his 4 children who are 5, 10, 15, and 17 years old. He is a man who works hard every day in order to be able to give his family the best. He is supported by his great passion, which is fishing, since it is thanks to this work that he can support his family and enjoy the pleasure he takes in it. Demecio feels happy to be able to have a way to provide support to his household, but the boat in which he does his work needs a repair and the purchase of spare parts, since it is damaged. For this reason he is asking FUSAI for a loan in order to buy spare parts and to pay for labor to repair the boat with which he does his work and thus be able to continue earning a living in this way.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for labor to repair the boat with which he does his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La'azarus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azarus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azarus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, La'azarus expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: In 2010, the borrower contracted Multi-Drug Resistant TB (MDR-TB). At the time, he was working at a footwear factory but had to quit  in order to receive treatment. For two years, while undergoing treatment, he was isolated from his three young children, the youngest only eight months old at the time of diagnosis. His wife withdrew from him as well, which made going through the long treatment even more difficult. The borrower was unemployed, about to lose his family and was borrowing from a small convenience store across the road in order to eat. In this context, he was referred to Partners In Health Peru, which provided assistance so that he was able to continue treatment. After he successfully completed it, he applied to the organization’s Income Generation project with a project for footwear sewing. He had an industrial shoe sewing machine which was no longer working so he received support to purchase a new motor and resume his activities. Presently, he is working consistently from home, is in good health and has recovered his relationship with his family. As demands for his products are growing, he has decided to expand his business by buying a new shoe sewing machine. It is his hope to be able to establish a small business in which he will not only make the shoes but also create his own designs.

loans.use: to buy a shoe sewing machine

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald es un hombre de 35 años de edad, soltero, tiene 1 hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de vidrios.
Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una zona agrícola que agrupa a productores campesinos y vendedores/distribuidores mayoristas, la producción agrícola que más se oferta es; la carne, los granos, verduras y frutas. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que sobrepasa los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Ronald es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta y colocación de vidrios, labor que realiza durante toda la semana a toda hora. Él se encarga de colocar vidrios en ventanas, puertas de vidrio, marcos de vidrio, mesas de vidrio y otros. “llevo bastante tiempo colocando vidrios, mi trabajo no tiene horario, muy pocas veces se me ha roto un vidrio…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de vidrios por mayor, para guardar en su depósito y contar con material de trabajo. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ronald solicita un préstamo para la compra de vidrios por mayor para contar con material de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ronald, age 35, is single and has a 12 year old son.  His business is selling glass.  He conducts his business in the El Torno area, an agricultural area that includes farmers and wholesale sellers and or distributors.  The agricultural production that is sold the most is meat, grains, vegetables, and fruit.  It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature above 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year.

Ronald has a dark complexion, short black hair, and is medium height.  His native tongue is Guaraní, and he speaks Spanish daily and for the business that he does.   He shares his life with is son, who goes to school.  They live in a rented brick house that has potable water and electricity.

His business is selling and installing glass.  He does this work during the entire week at all hours.  He takes charge of installing glass in windows, glass doors, glass frames, glass tables, and others.  “I have been installing glass for a long time.  My work does not have a schedule.  I have broken glass very few times,” he comments.

His dream is to improve the quality of his family’s life.  He wishes to invest in his business by purchasing glass wholesale to keep on hand in his shop and to have work material.  This is his sixth loan cycle with the institution in the nine years that he has been engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Ronald is requesting a loan to buy glass wholesale in order to have work material.

loans.use: to buy glass wholesale in order to have work material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of medications such as cough syrup, pain pills, ointments, etc.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 43-year-old married mother of two children who, twenty five years ago, started working as a hairdresser. She also sells make up and cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Majida is a hard working and ambitious woman who is trying her best to develop her business. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with more requested cosmetics and make up to satisfy her customers' needs.

This loan will help Majida increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more requested cosmetics and make up to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanamaqui Group

texts.es: El grupo “VIRGEN DE CHAPI DE YANAMAQUI” está conformado por socios ansiosos por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Elizabeth tiene 45 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la agricultura cultiva frutas que producen en su zona palta manzana para luego expenderlo al mercado mayorista.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejor la calidad de sus cultivos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elizabeth es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo azulino.
texts.en: The Virgen De Chapi De Yanamaqui group is made up of members who are eager to improve the quality of life of their families. Elizabeth is 45 years old and has a partner and two dependent children. She makes a living in farming. She grows fruit that is produced in her area, avocados and apples, that she then sells at the wholesale market. The loan will be invested in buying fertilizers to improve the quality of her crops. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan given. Elizabeth is the second from the left in the blue top.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: La Gran Alianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA GRAN ALIANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Rosa la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le piden, la socia desea que su negocio crezca, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, imprenta, cevicheria, crianza de animales menores, sastrería, venta de golosinas, mueblería.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "LA GRAN ALIANZA." The bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, department of Cusco.  

The member is Rosa and she continues to make a living buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens among others.  She is grateful for the loan she received and is committed to making the loan payments on time. She continues to raise her animals which she then sells to the customers that order them.  She wants her business to grow because this is how she supports her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs.

The other members make a living selling handicrafts, printing, cevicheria (restaurant), raising small animals, tailoring, selling candy and furniture.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de maíz y también la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de comida, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia quiere salir adelante, a la socia le gustaría tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to work on the business selling corn, and she also continues to work on the food business. Through these small businesses, she wants to move ahead. She would like to have a shop where she could sell the corn. She is asking for the loan in order to buy corn.

She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
La socia Magaly se dedica al negocio de botica,la socia vende medicamentos ,la socia trabaja en la botica desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de botica.La socia solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos para la botica.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Magaly manages a pharmacy business where she sells medicines. She works at her pharmacy from 8:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. Through this business, she wants to get ahead and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her pharmacy business.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy medicines for her pharmacy. Magaly is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 4 años de edad en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú, en la parte rural de este distrito.

La actividad que realiza es el transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, contando con unidad propia, así como también a la venta de gallinas y otros animales menores. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de animales así como también realizar arreglos a su mototaxi, con ello José espera generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
41-year old José is married and lives with his wife and 4-year old son in a simple house that he owns. His home is located in the rural part of Picará District, in Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru’s northern mountains.

José has a motorcycle taxi which he uses to transport passengers. He also sells chickens and other animals. The loan will be used to buy animals as well as to make some repairs to his taxi. Then he will be able to earn more money and improve his own and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy animals and make some repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Raif

texts.en:
Raif, a father of six, has sold clothes to earn an income for almost fifteen years. He also makes money by buying, repairing and then selling electrical appliances, a skill needed in his community. He is pictured here in his yard.

Raif has had problems with his electrical bills. The company who previously supplied electricity to his community failed in its operations. As a result, many households ended up being overcharged while others suffered no monetary obligations at all. A new company has now taken over, and its management is trying to straighten things out.

Meanwhile, Raif has been behind in paying his bill as it presently stands. He took out and successfully repaid a prior loan through VisionFund Albania and is now requesting a 50,000 ALL loan to help cover his bill.

A note: Some months ago Raif suffered a severe skull fracture. He was on his front porch when he was struck by an assailant. This resulted in a long hospital stay where he underwent multiple surgeries. He is doing better currently.

loans.use: to pay his electrical bills

loans.name: Mvukiyehe Mvukiyehe

texts.en:
Mvukiyehe, 37 years old, is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 4 years, not yet going to school. He is a farmer who has been farming for 20 years. Mvukiyehe would like to use the loan from Kiva to buy more fertilizers for growing maize to sell. His business profits will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for growing maize to sell

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en: Jameelah is a 20-year-old single lady. She has six siblings and they live in Jarash, Jordan. Jameeleh has always been fascinated by television shows that have to do with crimes and analyzing them. So, once she graduated from high school, she registered to major in crime studies at the university. Now Jameeleh is in her second year and is applying for a loan to help her pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to help her pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ezikiel

texts.en: Ezikiel is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ezikiel would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ezikiel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ezikiel is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is a 22 year old single man, living in Mafraq. Yazan is a second year student majoring in plant production at one of the big universities in the north of Jordan. Being a family of 13 members is a little bit difficult for his parents.

Yazan is applying today for a loan that would help him pay for his studies and some books that he couldn't afford.

loans.use: to pay for his studies and some books that he couldn't afford.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Nasiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Maniru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nasiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nasiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Nasiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure his child has a professional job.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amina Yakubu

texts.en: Amina Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Amina Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Bulha and Salama. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Amina Yakubu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amina Yakubu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Amina Yakubu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adom Wo Wiem Group

texts.en: Kwaku is a 45-year-old resident of the Krofofordo community of Assin North District in the Central Region of Ghana. Kwaku is married and has 10 children, all in school. Kwaku has been a cocoa farmer for the past 25 years. He earns his living selling cocoa beans each year. Kwaku is the representative of the Adom Wo Wien Group. All the group members live in the same community. Kwaku and his group members were among the people who received community exposure education on climate change, protecting the forest, and clean cooking from the field partner. Kwaku and his group members decided to use Elsa Clean Cookstoves to improve their lives. They need microfinance assistance to be able to purchase the stoves. The Elsa Clean Cookstove was developed through the research work of the African Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Science and Technology Programme, and co-financed by the European Union to reduce deforestation and indoor and outdoor air pollution. The stove uses virgin pellet, which is abundant in their community. Kwaku is requesting  a micro loan to enable him to purchase an Elsa Clean Cookstove to save them from smoke exposure. Kwaku is thankful to all his microlenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and agro-chemicals for use in his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 27 years old, is married and has one child, 2 years old, not yet going to school. Joseph is a farmer who has been farming for 10 years. Joseph would like to use the loan from Kiva to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell

loans.name: Las Capulinas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Las Capulinas, lo integran tres mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, la coordinadora es Esperanza una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, acompañada, que comercializa nacatamales y gaseosas de manera ambulante desde hace cinco años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de hojas de chagüites, carne, pollo, maíz, cajillas de Coca-Cola y big-colas de ½ litro y de litros. La segunda socia es la señora Jeaneth de 49 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa desde hace cuatro años y doña Jessenia de 38 años de edad, es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Las Capulinas consists of three women who fight for the well-being of their families.  The coordinator is Esperanza, a young entrepreneur who is 20 years old. She is in a cohabiting relationship, and has sold nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style steamed corn cakes] and carbonated drinks as a street vendor for the past 5 years.  She's requesting this loan to buy banana leaves, meat, chicken, corn, and cases of Coca Cola and Big Cola in 0.5- and 1-liter bottles.  

The second member is Jeaneth, who is 49 and has earned her living selling shoes and clothing for 4 years. Jessenia is 38 and has been the owner of a convenience store for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, meat, chicken, corn, cases of Coca Cola and Big Cola in 0.5- and 1-liter bottles, etc. in order to boost sales

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en: Gjelina's husband, Gjin, who has been photographed with her, makes marble headstones for tombs mainly, but also other related decorative items carved in stone. Gjelina needs this loan to pay for a machine to cut the stone.

loans.use: to buy a marble cutting machine; his profession is making marble headstones for tombs and other similar things.

loans.name: Menwah

texts.en:
Menwah is a 27 year old single lady with eight brothers and sisters. Being in a big family, pushed her to postpone her studies, till she could make some money to afford it. Now she is in her third year majoring in economics and business administration.

Menwah has started to look for a job related to her field where she can get some field experience and make some money but she wasn't yet lucky enough to find one. She is now applying for an educational loan to help her pay for her second semester at the university.

loans.use: to pay for her second semester at the university.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, and propane gas.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Susana tiene 32 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas golosinas útiles de higiene personal en su quisco y a la vez vende desayuno. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de más golosinas bebidas. Ella cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo “CORAZON DE JESUS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado por el crédito brindado.  Susana es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo viste casaca negra
texts.en:
Susana is 32 years old and is single.  She makes a living selling sodas, sweets, and toiletries in her kiosk, and at the same time she sells breakfast.  She will invest in the loan in buying more sweets and beverages.

She serves as president in the group "CORAZON DE JESUS" (Heart of Jesus).  The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan that they provide.

Susana is the second person on the left side wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and sweets.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Inusa, Shafiu and Ummaru.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Shehu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure they are eventually qualified to have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more energy-saving and environmentally-friendly cookstoves

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is a 56 year old. He is married with 7 children aged between 8 and 30 years, six of them attend school. He has been farming for 21 years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer to grow maize. He will then sell his maize harvest at a local market. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated her business for the past four years, providing transportation to tourists. She mentioned competition as the major challenge that she faces in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she wants to purchase spare parts to repair one of her faulty vehicles for her business continuity. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair one of her faulty vehicles

loans.name: Edison Manuel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Edison, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio. La mujer es ama de casa.
El señor Edison es un hombre muy trabajador que a base de esfuerzos saca adelante a su familia, el tiene un negocio en su casa, con la ayuda de su familia se dedican a la venta de comidas rápidas como  hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog, sanduches, tostadas, jugos y batidos de frutas entre otras cosas que preparan y venden y que son del gusto de sus clientes que a diario asisten a su local,  trabajan todos los días en las tardes y noches.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Andrés Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Leonidas Proaño Citadel, in the city of Manta. It is known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited in every season of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty, with many tourist attractions.

Edison lives here.  He is 49 years old and he has a common-law-marriage, from which he has two children, ages 16 and 14, who are studying in high school. His wife is a homemaker.

Edison is a hardworking man who supports his family through his hard work.  He has a business in his house, and his family helps him.  They sell fast food such as hamburgers, French fries, hot dogs, sandwiches, juice, and fruit shakes, among other things that they prepare and sell according to the tastes of their customers, who visit their shop daily.  They work every day during the afternoon and night.

He is going to use the loan to purchase the supplies needed for preparing the food.  He has been in the credit group for four years, and he likes it because of the help that the loans give him.  His dream is to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies.

loans.name: Gema Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Andrés se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leonidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gema, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Gema es maestra en una escuela de la localidad, pero para generar ingresos extra y así ayudar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días, sale a recorrer los fines de semana y también vende en su lugar de trabajo a madres de familia, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene más 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque así comenzó esta actividad. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
San Andrés Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Leonidas Proaño area of the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that people visit year-round and for being a city of incomparable beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.  Gema, 24, lives there.  She's single and lives in her parents' house.

Gema's a teacher in the community, but to earn extra income and help her parents, who are low income, she also works as a merchant selling Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day, goes out on the weekends, and also sells to mothers at her workplace.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She began this job with her first loan from the bank, and she has done it for more than two years.

She's going to use this loan to buy creams, perfume, costume jewelry, and cosmetics.

Gema has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because that's the way she started her job.  Her dream is to make progress.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfume, costume jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Takondwa Group

texts.en:
Alinafe, 28, supports her family by selling different kinds of commodities in her grocery such as sugar, rice and drinks. Alinafe is a mother of six children and she keeps two orphans. She started this business in order to support her family and to pay medical bills for her children. 

She will use the loan to buy more commodities for her grocery business in order to increase her profits. Increased profits will help her to overcome the challenges that her family has been facing. Her main goal is to have a wholesale business and she dreams of sending her children to better schools. The profits from the previous loan have helped her to build a better house for her family and she is now able to provide her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: Fidelina: Es una mujer miskita originaria de una comunidad del Río Coco; es luchadora, tiene 50 años de edad, madre soltera de cuatro hijos: Dos son mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Trabaja como maestra en una escuela rural de educación primaria. Desde hace 30 años habita en una pequeña vivienda  de madera; con el propósito de tener una vivienda más segura y con mejores condiciones, solicita financiamiento para iniciar a construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto, comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento y arena, Su sueño es poder  terminar de construir su casa de concreto, que tenga cuartos, cocina para poder vivir más segura con sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Fidelina is a Miskito woman, native to the community of Río Coco. She is a 50 year old, single mother of 4 children and a fighter. Two of the children are adults and two are adolescents who study at Secondary school. She works as a teacher in a rural primary school.

For 30 years she has lived in a small wooden house. With the goal of having a more secure house and better living conditions she is requesting a loan to start the construction, bit by bit of a concrete house. She will buy construction materials like cinder blocks, cement and sand. Her dream is to be able to complete the construction of her house made of cement that will have 4 rooms and a kitchen to be able to live more securely with her younger children.

loans.use: to start building her house out of cement, little by little buying construction materials like cinder blocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 62 years old. She is married with 6 children, aged between 14 and 25 years, four of whom go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy more maize fertilizers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more maize fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 60-year-old married woman and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to her husband's low social and financial status, she started a grocery shop 11 years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is a lovable woman and has a good reputation among her customers inside the camp, she works hard to develop her business. She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers during this winter season. 

She hopes to  provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her  merchandise with new products.

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.es: Zion es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por Carolina una joven de 20 años de edad con espíritu de superación, acompañada y madre de dos hijo, quienes son su mayor fuerza de superación, ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio, además comercializa cosméticos, este negocio lo impulsó hace dos años con ayuda financiera de su abuela, es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM e invertirá en cosméticos perfumes para damas y caballeros AVON, además en carne de res, plátano verde, plátano maduro, etc., de manera que le permitirá cubrir con la demanda que tiene de los servicios ofrecidos. Otra de las integrantes es Blanca de 31 años de edad propietaria de una panadería desde hace diez años en su domicilio y Fátima de 39 años de edad quien comercializa ropa de segunda mano en su domicilio desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
Zion is a solidarity group made up of three hardworking women.  The group is coordinated by Carolina, who is 20 years old and has a desire to succeed.  She is married and the mother of two children.  They are her greatest drivers to succeed.  

She works selling food from her home and also sells cosmetics.  She started this business two years ago with financial help from her grandmother.  This is her first loan with ADIM and she will invest in Avon cosmetics and perfumes for women and men, as well as beef, green plantains, ripe plantains, and other items so that she can meet the demand she has for her services.

The other group members are Blanca, 31 years old, who has owned a bakery in her home for ten years, and Fátima, 39 years old, who has sold secondhand clothing from her home for three years.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and kitchen supplies in order to offer quality products.
